Reviews: On tap. Funky peachy tart aroma. Taste of peach, sweet but leading into a big sour finish.. delicious.

650 ml bottle from Canada Craft Club.  Pours a cloudy brown colour with modest-sized light tan head.   Aroma is big coffee with a little vanilla and roast.  Flavour is lots of coffee, some cocoa and vanilla with a bit of a bourbon touch.  Fine carbonation.  Nice.

Beer Names: Other Half / Monkish Blowin' Up the Spot
Reviews: Pours a hazy, mustard yellow, with minimal head. Aroma is dank, with stinky cheese, some tropical and citrus notes. Flavor is sweet, with citrus and tropical fruit, just a slight touch of alcohol burn. Almost no hop bite in the finish. Smooth, soft mouthfeel.

Pint at the Hurricane Oyster Bar in Grayton Beach. Pours a clear, golden color, with a medium, frothy, off-white head. The nose is heavy mango, pineapple, hay and dust, wet grass, and corn syrup. Sweet and sugary, with a mild bitterness. Light body, with a fluffy, clean palate. This is a fun, fruity wheat, although the initial nose just reminds me of burning trashcan smell of potheads.

Pours hazy apricot that lets through just a little daylight at the edges. Ivory head is thick and tight. Aroma provides resiny and slightly dank hops, raw malt, tangy and slightly sweet citrus. Flavor offers piney and funky hops, raw malt, tangy and tart citrus, a hint of hay. Texture gives good body and perky fizz. After midnight, we're gonna drink some good craft beer.

Large off white head with good retention and a nice lace. Lightly hazy blond. Nose is mango and a little citrus. Body is medium, ain’t juicy, prickly carbo. Just some lightly sweet pale malts and lightly fruity hops. Dry, lightly bitter finish. Seems SN is trying a bit too hard. 12oz can from statelineliquors.

Beer Names: Burley Oak Jelly Not Jam - Cherry, Raspberry, and Strawberry
Reviews: Can from the brewery. Pours hazy orange/red with a thin, fizzy head. Tastes like tart citrus, berry, cookie malt, and sour yeast. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like berry, yeast, sour dough, and cookie malt.

Beer Names: Blue Moon Raven's Moon Asian Pear Cider
Reviews: Pours a flat white wine, soft pear on the nose with a hint of vanilla. Flavour is very soft pear mixed with some more vanilla. Full on the mouth the alcohol is well hidden, but it's rather uninteresting.
Pours with soft brown body and minimal foam, smells of brown sugar and those cheap halloween candies. Flavour is soft caramel and mountain due. Mouthfeel is cloying. This is a big miss for an ESB.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy dark brown with a thin head that dissipates quickly and completely. Aroma has slightly dark grains with toffee, light dark berries and a bit of apple brandy underlying. Flavor has slightly dark grains and toffee with touches of apple brandy, blackberry and a hint of caramel backing.

Beer Names: New Belgium Voodoo Ranger American Haze
Reviews: 12 ounce can from Woodman's Appleton, 2/6/20. Murky orange, large foamy white head, good retention. Aroma of dank, melon, pale malt and a bit of toast. Taste is resin, melon, dank, yuzu, pale malt. Medium bodied, low bitterness.

Pours with good beige foam on a nice black body, smells of nice sweet dark milk chocolate. Flavour is good sharp cocoa with hints of sweet barley. Nice dryness on the mouth. This is decent and filling.

Pint at the Hurricane Oyster Bar. Pours a clear, brown color, with a small, beige head. The aroma is caramel, resin, toffee, rose, and wheat bread. Sweet and malty, with a mellow bitterness. Light to medium body, with a thin, sharp palate. Mediocre aromatics for an IPA, and pretty thin and weak. Fair.

Can from Bottles in Providence, RI.  Very cloudy yellow-white, thin white medium-coarseness and moderate retention head.  Aroma is lovely big mango and dry mango, some dank onion, some passionfruit, some orange, touch of lime.  This smells lovely.  Medium weight, starchy semi-textured, slightly oily feel, medium-light carbonation, medium-coarseness, medium-light burn, silky.  Nice feel!  Flavor is sharp mango, bitter grapefruit, some dank herbs and onion, some orange, bit of tree sap, lingering green citrus and light rind bitterness.  Light and neutral barely balancing sweetness.  This is pretty great!

Draft at Cellarmaker on nitro. Dark brown with a lasting tan head. Aroma is roast, coffee, cocoa, earth. Flavor is dry and super balanced. Roasty, earthy, very nice. Medium body with a very smooth feel. Hell of a mild.
Bottle from friend. Pours brown no head or lacing. Notes are coffee, some tart cherry. No marshmallow to speak of. Taste medium bitter, medium sweet. Light body lively carbonation.
500 ml bottle pours a reddish color with a small white head.  Aromas of blackberries, stone fruit, light wine.  Medium bodied, very complex, a great beer.
Pours slightly hazy, light butterscotch. Light, hop aroma. Taste is floral, and tropical fruit, with a moderate bitter finish. It has a "juicy" palate. Very drinkable. (IBU not listed on can)
Bottle from friend. Pours brown coffee some head and lacing. Notes are cinnamon, chocolate, lactose. Taste huge sweet, medium bitter. Light body lively carbonation.

Beer Names: Sawdust City Maple Butter Tart Ale
Reviews: Can from friend. Well, it does what it says. Pours light brown lots of head and lacing. Nose is massive smell of butter tart. Notes are butter tarts... raisins, brown sugar, burnt butter, nutty. Taste huge sweet, light bitter. Light body lively carbonation. I think I have a cavity now.

12 oz can from Tavour, 2/6/20.  Pours purple, smallish head, no lace.  Smells like Manischewitz.  Tastes along the same lines.  Bit of vanilla, slightly.  This works better as a beer than it does as a Passover wine, but it's still not amazing.  Concord grapes might be a fruit that's just better for eating than drinking.  I think it's well made, no complaints there.  
7/3/7/3/15
Medium gold pour. Thin foam. Sweet nose of spices and hints of cocoa. Lovely lovely sweet  taste of coconut with a nice coconut pala
Can from friend. Pours brown coffee some head and lacing. Notes are roasted grain, some espresso, light tart berries. Taste medium bitter medium sweet. Medium creamy body lively carbonation.

Gift from a friend. Thanks a bunch Becky! Kona coffee, wormwood, honey nose. Hazy amber, medium cream colored head, effervescent. Sweet honey and coffee, molasses. Full body, easy carbonation. Much sweeter than it needs to be.  The coffee used is not my favorite either. Still, I'm stoked I got to try this and enjoyed it.

Firm medium size head with good retention and nice lace. Murky blond color. Nose of grapefruit, hint of sulfur. Medium body, not really “pillowy” as advertised, hint juicy. Little grainy, little citrus, little catty and maybe a hint of bandaids. Dry finish, citrus. Tangy.
Can from friend. ours clear golden some head and lots of lacing. Notes of grapefruit, grassy, pine. Taste light bitter light sweet. Medium body lively carbonation. Well done.

A:toasty malts, caramel, light roasted malts. App: deep reddish brown with smallish beige head. T/p: full body with sweet finish of average duration. Soft to moderate carbonation O: Pretty good. I won't lie, I was a bit surprise by the roasty malts but it doesn't feel too out of style. Good maltiness.

75CL, acquired in 2014 and forgot I had it. Finally opening February of 2020. "will age for decades" so let's see :) Dark reddish color, had a 7-up kind of carbonation when I poured it. can smell sweet syrupy brandy from a few feet away. maple syrup, baked apples and cinnamon aroma. wow, this has blended and aged so well. soggy oak, burnt sugar, vanilla, bible paper, ice cream, candied sugar and more apple. little bits of cherry and lovely smokey flavor with an oily grain alcohol finish. Easily the best of the anniversary beers.
Can from friend. Pours clear golden lots of head and some lacing. Notes are very floral and very fruity, lemon, grain, citrus. Taste light bitter light sweet. Light body lively carbonation.

The Aromas are crackers, Hops, straw and pale malt. Flavors are a little more sweet than light bitter. Very mild, hops and whole home. Okay body. Carbonation and finish. Boulevard could have done better with this.
Can from Liberty store. Pours black lots of head and lacing. Notes are milk chocolate, roasted marshmallows, coffee. Big sweet, medium bitter. Creamy body medium carbonation.
16 oz draft pours an light orange color with a small white head.  Aromas of citrus, pine, resin, a good old fashioned west coast IPA.  Medium bodied, nicely balanced, a very good beer.

12.7 oz corked and caged. About a year and a half old. Aroma is raspberry, Band-Aid, medicinal. Pours slightly hazy ruby red with a crackling, quickly dissipating head. Taste is highly sour (9/10) with flavors of raspberry, lemon; the medicinal and Band-Aid flavors are there in flavor, but not as in your face as in the nose. Flawed but drinkable.
Can shared by beerboxer. Pours hazy gold with a nice white head and a citrus aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a dry finish.

It's fine, I was expecting better. Paid a pretty penny for a limited imported run into Australia but isn't really that great in comparison to other milk stouts that are cheaper and more readily available here already. Tastes flat and really lacks in a defining milky taste that you'd expect from a milk stout.

Murky golden orange pour with one finger off-white head. Some citrus and fruit in the aroma/flavor. Bright, grassy and a touch zesty. Overall, somewhat muted and one dimensionsal. I enjoyed it but wouldn't go back.

Beer Names: New Belgium Nitro Cold Brew Cream Ale
Reviews: On Tap  medium brown color and a find even thin skin of micro bubbles.  Light toasted malts and a gentle soft coffee aroma and flavor.  Very drinkable and a touch of chocolate to go with the coffee.  Probly the best and easiest drinking coffee beer Ive had.

Pours pale gold into a stange. Bright white head with medium retention recedes to coat surface. Caramel and hay aromas. Soft with hay, grass and sourdough upfront turning to lemon/lime (?!) in the medium length finish.

Beer Names: Dogfish Head American Beauty Hazy Ripple IPA
Reviews: On Tap.  Classic hazy light golden straw color. Soft wheaty floral, tropical aromas and fa=lavors.  Flowery even.  Soft pillowy finish.  A littel allspice or clove at the end. A bit fancy and pretentious but pleasant and soft.

12oz can from Windsor Hy-Vee, in a Sam Smith pint glass. Aromas of vanilla, caramel, malted barley, wet grass, forest floor, milk chocolate and dark-roast coffee. Pours deep chocolate brown with one finger of foamy chocolate head that dissipates rapidly. Opens crisp and acidic for its style with creamy sweet roast taking charge on the mid-palate and a long roasty and somewhat hoppy finish. Medium- to full-bodied with mild stickiness and astringency in the end, just a touch. Not bad! Nose is very appealing, flavor is a bit generic, but the price is great and it's very drinkable.
On Tap  Clear medium golden with a  lasting dense white head. Strang clean hard biting piney and somewhat chemically hop bitterness.   Clean dry finish

My old man's go to. Very important to get the imported variant rather than the domestically brewed stuff. Although, it's not really that great and I'd have a few choices over it at the price point. A bit bolder than the regular macro lager, but otherwise quite standard.

Bottle from Bine & Vine. Pours hazy ruddy brown with a slight beige head. Aroma of slight musty oak and brandy. Note: This should also be placed in Calvados barrels. There's medium dark fruit notes. Can't parse out malt. There is heat mixed in the aroma. Full bodied. Flavor is musty oak, brandy, red berries, roasty malt, brown sugar. Heat is detectable, but so subtle it has to be paid attention to - cause the overall flavors really obscure it. Not dry, but something, perhaps heat, tends to balance out the malt. This is excellent.
Can smell the cream, pineapple and some coconut. Get mostly cream and some sweet pineapple. Decent.
Another lame macro lager. Boring and watery. I don't know why people bother to import this into Australia when there are a billion beers like it already available.

16 oz. Aroma is Smarties, Tang, oranges, bready. Pours hazy golden with large-ish chunks of sediment floating around; has a one finger bone-white head with decent retention. Taste has a moderate pithy  bitterness, a light to moderate sweetness, with flavors of Tang and oranges, peel and pulp, vanilla. Not bad.
16 ounce can.  Pours black with a decent tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, malt, vanilla, and coconut.  Taste is chocolate, vanilla, coconut, roasted malt, and a bit of coffee.  Nice to sip on.

500 ml. bottled 10/29/2019. Slightly foggy, chestnut brew with a creamy film of foam. Interesting aroma of pineapple upside-down cake with touches of cocoa, grapefruit and orange. Flavor has bread, orange, grapefruit, toffee, white pepper, toasted walnut and a touch of coffee. Medium body has medium-high carbonation that's almost too much but remains smooth enough. Easy drinking balance that finishes nutty and dry.
Keg @ Castle Hotel, Manchester.  Golden with a creamy head.  It's certainly styled well and is crisp with a fair carbonation.  This one is for lager lovers only though.
Cask @ Abel Heywood, Manchester.  Blonde with a creamy head.  It's a very easy textured hoppy ale with some bitterness.
An excellent example of a style I really enjoy. Light, crisp with a nice hop profile.
Cask @ Jack In The Box at Mackie Mayor, Manchester.  Copper-red with a small head.  Has a bittered crisp hoppiness, but not that flavoursome.
Cask @ City Arms, Manchester.  Fuller hazed yellow-amber with a frothy head.  Has a citrus hoppiness, evident in both aroma and taste.

Cask @ Crown & Kettle, Manchester.  Practically black with a creamy-frothy off-white head.  Its' gritty, milky-sweet in its dark maltiness, and dryish, all of which is an odd mix but it just about works.  Has a denser mouthfeel than its texture would suggest.

12 oz. can   Pours a thick, well retained, off white head, with extensive variable lacing, over a slightly hazy dark yellow (SRM 4) body.....nose is pine, resin, herbal, slight grapefruit, mild malts.......taste is mild malts, juicy taste notes with grapefruit tones, herbal hops with moderate bitter finish.....mouth feel, medium body, slight alcohol, moderate almost creamy carbonation. This is a drinkable, enjoyible IPA.

Well I grabbed this brew from Foothills because I was curious if this was the same beer as the Cottonwood Frostbite winter ale I remember having many years ago at a beer festival. Although apparently Foothills bought out some of Cottonwood’s brands, this beer has a very different profile than what I remember of the Cottonwood rendition. Rather than being a boozy strong ale, this is a brisk clean-finishing and true-to-style black IPA with a fairly light roastiness and a balanced hoppy bitterness. The appearance was excellent also, with a bright white foamy head that almost imitated the cascading presentation of a Guinness stout. Aroma was charred wheat and herbal pacific hops, and the flavor likewise was a balanced mix of roasted malt and fresh bitter hops. Only mild disappointment with this beer was the lack of nuance - no complex chocolate or coffee notes or bold hop flavors - but that being said I enjoyed this and would pick it up again. Not my favorite black IPA, but possibly my favorite offering from Foothills Brewing.

12 oz can. Pour is amber in color.Head is minimal but persistent. Aromas  of tropical fruit with no discernible dominant flavor. Mouthfeel is crisp with slight bitterness. 7.2 abv is well integrated if not hidden behind the crisp bitterness of this IPA.

375ml bottle. Clear, dark chestnut colour with ruby glimmer and small, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, beige head. Fruity, yeasty and slightly breadyand minimally nutty, malty aroma, notes of dried fruit, raisin, fig, date, sweet-ish and earthy hints of honey, some treacle, a touch of chestnut. Taste is dry, minimally sweet, minimally bitter, yeasty fruity and bready malty, notes of plum and cherry, dried fruit, raisin, fig, date, some treacle, honey, blue grapes, a touch of apple, baked apple, chestnut and even Brazil nut; minimally warming, alcoholic finish. Relatively watery texture with a minimally slimy touch, slightly prickly carbonation. Rich and complex, definitely a sipper, but partially so light and almost refreshing that you might be teased to speed up the frequency of sips into dangerous areas. Really nice and accommodating, but not exposing sufficient signs of individual character nor terroir to make a name for itself comparable to the classics in this style.

12 oz. can purchased at Total Wine & Liquor in Colorado Springs, CO. Pours a clear dark amber color with a small khaki head and good retention. Decent lacing. Fermented caramel aroma. Clean caramel malt flavor with a short, minimal acidic finish. Low carbonation. Pretty simple and straightforward.

Pours a clear bright golden yellow with a big foamy white head. Tart citrusy aroma. Taste is rather blah with notes of citrus rind flavor. Finishes fairly smooth with a lingering bitter aftertaste. Not very refreshing nor enjoyable.

Sampled from the tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy earthy yellow with a white head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has dank papaya and citrus with a strong onion note supporting. Flavor is onion forward with dank papaya and bitter citrus underlying.

Beer Names: Weathered Souls Kicked Out The Waffle House
Reviews: Bottle from beerboxer. Pours near black with a transient brown head and a huge complex aroma that includes chocolate, vanilla and coffee. There is a full-bodied dark molasses flavor with a ton of chocolate and a tasty coffee finish. Warm alcohol trail.

Beer Names: Flossmoor Station Kratos Imperial Stout - Barrel Aged
Reviews: Dark beer out of the bottle with a creamy beige head. Big rich bourbon stout nose. Really nice rich impy stout with roasted grains, dark brown sugar, and bourbon flavors. Very well balanced and very drinkable.

Pours a golden yellow. 
Little to no white head

Tasting notes of
Sweet peach. Very light 3/10
Smooth sour finish 3/10

Beer Names: Great North Hazy Rotation - Batch Six - Citra/Mosaic
Reviews:
Can from the source. 
Hazy lightly murky lemon yellow in color with a decent sized off white head that persists. Earthy grassy lemony citrus and island fruits with a bit of bready malt to back it up.
Cloudy orange gold pour. Thin white head. Butterscotch sweet berry aroma. Taste is sweet and tart. Lots of berry taste. Very good if you are tired of the same old same old. Refreshing. Classified.
Hazy golden pour. Wispy white head. Very scattered lacing. Butterscotch and lingonberry nose. Tart and fruity but with a sweet quick finish. More fruit than beer, but not bad.

Pint with Kieran at spoons. 

You know what, it's an endearing ale. A classic session ale. Amber, sun tanned malty brew.

You can't go wrong with this. Lots of yeasty notes in both the smell and taste, caramel malt, honey, a touch of heather. It's quite full in terms of mouthfeel. Something to glug on a Sunday. Readily available and tasty. Classic.

Stille Nacht Ottobre 2019. Ambrata carica, schiuma compattissima e pannosa. Aromi intensi di luppolo in fiore e zucchero candito. Al palato risulta strutturata in modo equilibratissimo : inizio caloroso e riscaldante dovuto all'alcol, che poi sfuma in dolci note speziate di caramello, luppolo, frutta matura, tutto fuso assieme e incredibilmente omogeneo. Finale morbido, rotondo, con un leggero retrogusto acidulo, mascherando la gradazione alcolica.

Draught. Pours clear black with a medium, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate roast and chocolate malt, earthy rich coffee, sweet vanilla, prunes, and a medium sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
330 ml bottle. Doesnt smell like beer. Golden color big head.  Very very soft. Perfect for the beach i guess. Bad beer.

Paid through the nose for this at bread and roses pub in Plymouth. With Kieran. Pint each. 

I don't know, it's fresh and spiky and very drinkable. But im left feeling refreshed with nothing else of note. It's a nice brew all the same. Pine notes, grapefruit. Not much body, served too cold for me. 

2 pints of this came in around the £11 mark and felt a bit robbed.... It's a nice beer but seriously Lidl are a great pils at 4.8% that I enjoy more. Sorry for the rant.

Bought at Gerrard’s Market from Redlands, California for $15.99, West Meets East is a golden ale brewed with kiwi and kumquat aged in wine barrels crafted by Highwater Brewing Company from San Jose, California.

The aroma of a musty funk, kiwi, white wine, and elderflower are noted as you drink. The appearance is a golden orange with a minimal white head. When held up to light, a cloudy yellow shows. The alcohol content is 6%.

Kumquat provides a juicy tang along with a moderate sour on the take. Kiwi sweetens and smoothens the drink. A white wine hue accompanies the kiwi. Wild yeast gives off a musty funk to the slightly dry finish and leaves a soft lactic, tart touch on the mouthfeel. Elderflower colors the wine and funky frame. Oak offers a woodsy aspect to the lactic and elderflower notes. Biscuit malt gleams with the kiwi and white wine blend.

West Meets East is a beautiful sour blonde ale. The kiwi, kumquat, white wine, funky wild yeast, biscuit malt, and elderflower combination sets this beer apart. The kumquat and lactic blend into a dazzling medley. The sour and tart are strong when the beer is cold and mellows as it warms. The elderflower compliments the kumquat and kiwi notes. I treasured each drink and impressed by its complexity and depth. 

Cheers. Prost. Drink for the love of beer.

For more beer reviews, visit and like my blog “Drink For the Love of Beer.”

Draught. Pours clear dark amber with a medium, creamy off-white head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate grapefruit and resin hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium honey and toast malt with a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Pint with Kieran at spoons. 

Hard to rate this... But I got to go high. It's a belter of an ale, an event ale, turned up to 11. Dark, mysterious and full on. 

Pours a black, deep black with white head. Looks like a champion in the glass. You know your in for flavour. 

Big aromas of prunes, Cali raisins, dark chocolate, malt, more malt, yeast, toffee, sugar. 

Taste follows with a refreshing sweet heavy finish. More rum touches, porter and stout notes. Deep and heavy ale but its just brilliantly made and consistent. Well done Exmoor.

Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Heavy pine and grapefruit hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium biscuit malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Dark black with a large khaki head and nice lacing. Nose is bourbon barrel, banana bread, toffee, and roast. Flavor is really smooth and easy going for the percent. Coconut barrel, fudge, char, and more roasted malt. Medium bodied, and not too sticky for the style.

Loved this! Pint with Kieran in the spoons. 

Classic old ale. Heavy, thick, drinkable with all of these leather touches mixed in with malt and caramel. 

Pours a deep copper, thick stew like. Lovely flavour boarding on a porter with these coffee touches and old furniture. All the same it's drinkable. Very very smooth. 

Top notch.

Beer Names: FrauGruber / Dry & Bitter Slaves Of Convenience
Reviews: On tap at 100 Piv Bratislava. Murky yellow/orange coloured, medium sized white to off-white head, citrus and mild tropical fruits in the nose. Sweet malty, fruity, light citrus and dank with notes of alcohol in the finish.

Draught. Pours clear black with a medium, frothy off-white head, short retention. Medium rich roast and caramel malt, dates and figs, light hop bitterness, and a medium dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Easy sweet pils. 
Pours a lovely golden straw colour with a lasting head. Rich malt smell, toffee touches. A sweet pils for sure. 

Taste follows, easy pils, not too much to get excited about but it's a quality brew. Would have this again no problem on a hot day.

Beer Names: Samuel Smiths Organic  Apricot  Fruit Beer
Reviews: 355ml bottle. Amber colour with white head. Big sweet apricot, malty, sweet wheaty, sweet apricot jam, floral, light honey, light citrus, light tartness, light white sugar, light bitterness. Not super complex but v refreshing + drinkable, lots of sweet apricot but not in an artificial way, nice
Can. Dark golden, slightly cloudy. Hop aroma with some malt.  Really good. Strong, with good but not the very strong hop flavor many DIPAs have.

Draught. Pours clear golden orange with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Medium herbal coffee, spicy notes, medium dough malt, and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Pours thick black with thin dark tan head. Aroma is cocoa, maple syrup, roast and cinnamon. Taste is chocolate, maple syrup and brown sugar, moving to cinnamon and roast. Finish is chocolate, maple syrup and cinnamon.

Draught. Pours clear yellow with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Medium rich biscuit malt, medium citrus hops and hop bitterness, a clean lager character, and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
Banana, light hoppyness, refreshing and sweet. This beer is completely drinkable and doesn't deserve this hate. A zero? No Lol...
Can from Cap Tap. Pours clear gold with a thick white head and a citrus aroma. There is a near full-bodied pale malt flavor with with a very bitter finish.

6 pack of 12 ounce bottles from a Kroger in Roanoke. Date stamp is 01-09-2020, I assume this is a bottling date and not a bb date. Pours a slightly hazy, copper-chestnut color with an enduring film of cream. Nose of toffee, earthy peat, toasted nut, orange and a whiff of sourish apple. Flavors of the same stuff with more from the apple than indicated in the aroma. Medium bodied with a pleasant, low-medium carbonation and a nice balance. Mild astringency from the peat plus pithy hop notes help to dry the big malts quite well at the finish.

Black appearance with a bubbly tan head. Aroma of toasted oak, roasted malt, bitter chocolate and light earthy notes. Similar flavor, oaky and roasty with mild sweetness and mild bitterness. Medium to full body with a soft feel and a lingering woody finish.

440ml can from We Brought Beer, Balham.  Black with a tan head.  Aroma of vanilla, coffee, roasted malt, treacle and dark sugar.  They really nailed this flavour-wise.  Neither too strong on the vanilla, the lactose nor the coffee.  Just a really nice beer, with lovely nuance of flavour.

Bottle from barrell and still shop, Plymouth. 

Loved this, very clean amber colour appearance, no haze but a decent look to it. 

Lots of nice citrus notes alongside orange tints in the aroma. Juicy! Taste also has these tiny pine needles. A very sessionable pale indeed. Enjoyed it.
[Cask at the Old Manor (JDW), Bracknell.] A pale amber pour with a tight white head; grassy aroma; and a caramel malt body; then a biscuity finish with a twiggy bitterness. A simple bitter.

Beer Names: Singlecut Eric More Cowbell! Chocolate Milk Stout
Reviews:
Had to get this one, if only to send a pic to my best buddy of the same name.

Pours dark with a finger of brown head that fades to a thick ring, light lacing. Aromas are heavily roasted malt and sweet vanilla. Excellent tasting stout with mellow notes of cocoa, vanilla, and lactose sweet - none of which are overdone. Super smooth light-medium mouthfeel, and semi-bitter roasty finish. Well done!

Beer Names: Contrary Life After Breakfast Smoked Maple Coffee Porter
Reviews: Black appearance with a tan head. Enticing aroma of gourmet coffee, maple syrup, mild caramel and light smoky malts. Similar flavor, rich, layered and moderately sweet with a light earthy bitterness. Medium body with a pleasant finish. Nice!
Canned on the train.  Dark pour, malts etc and pretty oiky. Decent enough..
Beautiful hazy gold pour, white head with nice lacing. Lots of grapefruit and lemon, oatt mouthfeel. Not bad.

Beer Names: Contrary Punch You In The Eye
Reviews: Deep orange appearance with light red hues and a white head. Smooth and fruity with pleasant sweetness and light Belgian esters. Medium to full body with a mild plum finish. Good.

Very malt-forward for an American wheat ale, with an outsized toasted bread and caramel backbone overshadowing the more gentle grassy, fruit-tinged notes of the style. Hints of lemon and orange backed up by mild floral hops offset the malt, but it's hard to find much balance or nuance. Not bad, but not what you'd expect.

Beer Names: Dogfish Head Midas Touch Golden Elixir
Reviews: Slightly cloudy golden pour. Thin white ring of head. Sweet honey and flower like aroma. Taste is very sweet like honey. Dandelion with some ancient yeast. Interesting complex and totally unique. Nice one.

Acquired a can in a trade with tfontana, thanks Tom! Can date of 1-21-20. Is this any different than then King Julius? Maybe a tad more juice? How much juice can one IPA actually have? After reviewing my notes of king Julius...  Yes this has a huge juicy character. This also has absolutely no bitterness. No green hop either. So the fruit juice, lasts and lasts and lasts. This really is tasty. Soooo, ok... I like it.

Il profumo esce sicuro dall'invecchiamento in botti di bourbon e il sapore ne assume senz'altro i connotati. Anche il caramello è uno dei sapori e profumi che si percepiscono bene, mentre in sottofondo si sentono agrumi e malto. Una ALE senz altro degna di nota anche se molto alcolica per i miei gusti.
Pours light dirty water orange. Nose is citrus and pineapple, pine. Taste is citrus, lemon, grapefruit, pineapple, melted plastic citrus piss, lingering resin. Solid

Beer Names: Cervecería Colorado / Cerveza Cru Cru Churro Stout
Reviews:
On draught at Frontier Brewing and Taproom.

Pours black with hues of red, small and rapidly disappearing head of foam, very little lacing.

I get lactose, light roast, chocolate that leans towards the bitter side. Doesn't smell like the churro that I have smelled...

Milky, light roast, bitterish chocolate, light sweetness; light sweetness could have been bumped up and I would be happier.

Light body. All the beers I have tried from this brewery seem to be light bodied.

It's okay.
On tap at Sir Club, Odense. Cloudy copper with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of toffee, vanilla, and plenty of fresh oak. Sweet malty flavour with oak and vanilla.
Very hazy orange yellow color. Aroma of sugar, orange, citrus, vanilla. Medium bodied, no bitterness, easy to drink added flavor hazy.

Can as a gift around X-mas.  Super cloudy, apricot in color, good head. Good lacing left on the glass. Nose of biscuits and flaked oats. Taste is tons of tropical fruits. Mango, apricot, banana, tangerine, oranges, etc. Well balanced with a good malt body.  Smooth for a 7% beer. Overall this is an easy drinking, good tasting beer.
Bottle from Asda. A clean golden brew, thin head, nice citrus notes on the nose and palate. Good value beer.

Beer Names: Bolero Snort Mue: Shake, Cattle & Roll
Reviews: 16 oz can from Joe Canal's, 2/6/20.  Fully hazed golden-orange color with a moderate head and some light, streaky lacework.  Orange / tangerine, vanilla and mango.  Fairly sweet.  Slightly cloying.  Pretty good, but maybe too much vanilla.  Still, pretty good overall.

Draught. Pours lightly hazy dirty orange with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Heavy pine, spruce, and resin hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium bready malt, light alcohol, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.
Clear gold pour. Thin tan ring of head. Mildly sweet malty caramel aroma. Taste is pretty much the same. Malty. Mildly sweet. Smooth easy drinker.

Can from mix pack.
Slightly hazy yellow with a tall, frothy, white head.
The aroma is citrus, flowery, sweet perfume.
The flavor is slightly on the sweet side, with tropical and citrus fruitiness.

Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, creamy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Heavy grapefruit and floral hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium bready malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with light lacing. Heavy orange and mango hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium cracker malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Beer Names: Hawkshead Northern Imperial Stout Bourbon Barrel Aged
Reviews: Bottle at home in Hackney - sourced from online, I suppose. Pours deep brown with a modest, foamy beige head. Impressively smooth, with nice vanilla notes, rounded and relaxed chocolate character, soft roast, mocha, a little coffee ice cream and figs. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Mild warmth in the finish, nips of berries, more chocolate, some rocky road, vanilla, toasted marshmallows, burnt caramel. Excellent.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate floral and peach hops, medium hop bitterness, medium grainy biscuit Pils malt, and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Pure golden pour with a slight white head.  Toast,  caramel malt,  honey and some metallic notes from the hop bill. Clean and malty throughout.  It does one thing, but that thing is very good. A simple clean German lager.

From a can to a glass. Pours a slightly hazy light gold color with a massive frothy creamy silky head. Aroma is dank piney hops upfront with hints of sweet bready malts. Taste follows the aroma with hints of fresh spearmint, lemon, slight earthy hops, caramel malts. Medium mouthfeel alcohol very well hidden. Awesome Dipa!
Juicy, mild grass, very juicy appearance, bitter, grassy, fruity, thin, very drinkable 5.6%

Gold pour, little haze, finger of white head.  Nose is citrus and grain.  Middle is blood orange (not to strong), light berry, some melon, little spice, light kilned malt. Finish is fruity and yeasty.  Nice mouthfeel for the ABV.

Beer Names: Boneyard Dibble Dabble With A Dubbel
Reviews: Draught. Pours clear tawny with a medium, frothy white head, short retention. Moderate rich caramel and toasted bread malt, banana esters, dates, and a medium dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

On draught at Frontier Brewing and Taproom.

Pours a clear pale gold with a fine layer of foam. Light lacing.

Smells like a Lager. Some malt, some hops, not a lot of grains.

Taste matches the smell, kinda dry finish. Very quaffable and the mouthfeel is decent.

Draught. Pours clear black with brown highlights and a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate roast malt, bitter malt and hops, dark fruits of raisins and plums, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Beer Names: Five Points / Lost And Grounded Double Dry Hopped IPA
Reviews: Can, from Tesco. Faintly hazy gold, thin but sustaining white head and gentle condition. Pleasantly fruity sweet in the nose with a solid balancing hop resin note tinged with pine and citrus. A little flat in the mouth but still full bodied and well balanced, with some candy sugar sweetness and gentle peppery hop resin, finish is muted but persistent with a lingering hop resin bitterness and a sweet lemon note.

Draught. Pours clear black with brown highlights and a small, frothy beige head. Medium rich coffee, dates, medium caramel malt, toffee notes, and a lightly sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Draught. Pours lightly hazy amber with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Heavy grapefruit, tangerine, and mango hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear red with a small, frothy white head, short retention leaving a cordon. Moderate cherry, tart and acidic, light malt, soft phenols (smoky), and a dry finish. Medium body and light carbonation.
On tap at Mikkeller Odense. Cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma of chocolate with coffee, green pepper and ashtray. Dry and tart fruity and spicy flavour.

Half pint on draught at German Kraft Mayfair, London. Very dark brown colour with white head. Sweet smoked malt, rauchbier smoke, bready, campfire, light smoky bacon, light bbq sauce, light dark fruit. Nice one

On draught at Frontier Brewing and Taproom.

It pours a straw gold with a small head of foam that lasts. Nice lacing.

I smell pineapple, some sweetness associated with that, light grain. Simple.

Taste is light, pineapple, light grain and sweetness, mild bitterness.

Light body, light flavours but good overall.

Color amarillo levemente pálido, sin apenas turbiedad, casi transparente. Espuma blanca de poco más de un dedo de espesor y media retención. Aroma a frutas blancas, ciruelas verdes sobre todo, floral y salado. Sabor a frutas blancas ligeramente ácidas, leve sal y unas notas de cereal, final medio corto, ácido y ligeramente salado, alcohol imperceptible. Textura acuosa. Carbonatación media.

Equilibrada y redonda, sin ningún elemento destacando, ni siquiera la sal.

Beer Names: Fat Head’s / Three Floyds Special Hoperations IPA
Reviews: Draft to pint at The Pint Room. Looks good; definitely more FH than FFF though. A completely transparent golden orange with foamy eggshell head. Smells and tastes of dank, piney, and citrusy hops alongside a moderately bittersweet backbone. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and pleasantly bitter. A good WC(ish) IPA. A refreshing change of pace from all the hazy IPAs on tap everywhere.

Kolor słomkowy, klarowny. Piana biała, wysoka, średnio trwała.
Aromat delikatnie słodowy, nieco słodki.
Smak podobnie jak aromat słodowy i co najważniejsze nie śmierdzi.
Wysycenie średnie do wysokiego, Ciało na poziomie średnim.
Draft at bar hop. Hazy opaque raspberry body, small pink head. The aroma has raspberry, the taste is sour and bold.
Anice clean slightly oxidized atout, bit a good malt bill. Gbbf 2020 on cask real ale

Beer Names: Four Saints Rye, Oh Rye IPA
Reviews:
This is one beautiful beer.  Amazing 
bright clear reddish brown.  Thick off white head.  Plenty of lace.  The rye is in the front in both aroma and flavor.  Lots of resiny pine as well.  Very earthy hop bill. Starts with a bitter smack  Some leathery notes and lots of toffee and caramel malt unfold next. A long earthy bitter fade follows with some citrus and berry notes. Excellent.

Beer Names: Denver Peanut Butter Graham Cracker Porter
Reviews:
Bue en pression 25cl au Délirium Café de Caen.
Au nez c'est une impression de nutella donnée grâce au beurre de cacahuète.
La robe est d'une noir d'ébène avec une mousse légère et une carbonatation également légère.
En bouche l'ensemble est pour commencer sucré, pateux et crémeux grâce au goût de beurre de cacahuète suivi d'une amertume de café qui viens équilibrer le tout.

Beer Names: Buxton / Omnipollo Original Raspberry Meringue Ice Cream Pie
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml shared with Miro B, Max, Simon. Dark cloudy red with white head. Berries, vanilla, yoghurt, sweetish, some sourness. Soft texture. OK I guess, but not my favorite kind of beer.

Bottiglia. All'olfatto si esprimono sentori di sour e di vinoso. L'olfatto viene stimolato in maniera elevata e l'esistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma resiste poco. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di aspetto nuvoloso. Bollicine fini costituiscono la forma del perlage, con carbonazione persistente. Il colore è ambrato carico tendente rossiccio. Il corpo è pieno. L'amaro è contenuto e c'è anche una componente moderatamente acidula. La forza gustativa è elevata. La continuità gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di birra beverina. Il finale è bruschino. Il retrogusto è di decente intensità. Al gusto vengono donati sentori di caramello, miele, crosta di pane, frutta secca, agrumi, pompelmo, lampone, ciliegia e vino rosso.

Beer Names: Cocksure African Blackberry, Raspberry & Gooseberry Stout
Reviews: Jet black colour with a large, lasting  beige head. Aromas of chocolate malt, dark berries and a hint of spice. Roast chocolate malt, blackberry and raspberry flavours in taste. Initial zesty sweetness, moving to sour notes with gooseberry and finishing with lasting strong medium bitter roast malt flavour.
Gutes, typisches NEIPA mit viel tropischer Frucht, leicht süß säuerlich mit einer schönen milden Hopfenbitterkeit zum Abgang.
Clean nice beer crisp light and drinkable and good beer. Greta bbf 202020 birmingham

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL. dispensed to only a snifter showing an ultra cloudy, pulpy orange color, with a presentable layer of soft white froth, and a sheeting band of lacing. The nose was rather expressive, with mild dankness, citrus, tropical fruit as pineapple & mango, creaminess, sweetness, and a touch of vanilla. Medium bodied, the taste was similar, the sweetness & cream seemed to disappear, as the carbonation was rather low, thus prompting the notion of thinning texture. Bitterness was fruity, rind-like, pulpy, and earthy, with some dryness to the finish. All the right notes in the wrong proportions. Also, not necessarily snifter worthy for the price point.
Canette de 355 ml. Arômes de fruits exotiques et de houblon. Goût de pamplemousse, d'ananas et de houblon. Bonne IPA standard.
Keg @ Jack In the Box at Mackie Mayor, Manchester.  Golden with a creamy-frothy head.  Has a light Helles styling, but is evident enough with perhaps its crispness its best feature.
Cask @ Abel Heywood, Manchester.  Darker brew with a small head. It's not overly fruity but the actual blackberry is evident within its taste.

Bottle. Clear copper liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of floral hops, earth, bready malt, citrus and light caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of malt, wort, raw sugar and table sugar. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice aroma but overly sweet, worty taste. Same problem as many other NAs.

Beer Names: Cloudwater One Slice To Yule Them All
Reviews: Can at home. Pours black with a dirty tan head. Aroma is banana, chocolate, boozy fruit cake, molasses. Taste is a big boozy fruit cake, treacle, banana. Finishes with boozy zing. Drinks below 11%. Lovely and smooth. Great stuff

Beer Names: Leon Steiner Premium Lager Beer Strong
Reviews:
(can 0,5l) Overall: Below average strong lager.
 Aroma: Light malty, light grainy, honey-like.
 Appearance: Clear golden. Quickly done, white head.
 Taste: Medium sweet, honey-like, alcohol.
 Palate: Medium body. Light alcohol finish.
Clean light mildly roasty porter, a nice mild ale with nothing off but the oxidation from the real cask ale. Gbbf birminghame 2020

Reddish brown beer with a medium head. A nice doppelbock with a kick. Compared to the other schlenkerla beers, this beer has a more spicy smoke tast. if the normal bock is smoked ham, this is smoked beef. Very nice
Cask @ Crown & Kettle, Manchester.  A thick black paste with a creamy light brown head.  Has a smoother dark maltiness with lots of alcohol, and decent barrel ageing.
Cask @ Pilcrow, Manchester.  Dark golden with a small head.  Has a mild but brash tasting bitterness, and it's somewhat dank for it.
Schmeckt ähnlich wie Becks. Leicht herb, leicht muffige Bitterkeit und recht lieblos und wässrig.
Cask @ Beatnikz Republic Bar, Manchester.  Golden with a head.  It's watery-hoppy with a hint of fruit in its nose.

AR: (kratziger) Hopfen, Zitrus, Tropenfrucht, pfeffrig, 
AP: milchigtrübes weissgelb
TA: (kratziger) Hopfen, Tropenfrucht, Zitrus, Hefe
Recht angenehm leichter Bock. Malz dominiert mit leichten Brotaromen, feiner Süße und cremigem Mundgefühl. Zum Abgang etwas würzig.

Clear yellow tint from a bottle. Big white head. Nose is clean beer with some lemon, barely. First taste is bubbly fun, refreshing. Not sure if I can pick out the orange but fer sher the lemon is there. Second gulp is easy going, not as much of the lemonade thing going on here like many shandies, its just good beer with a tad of citrus.   I can appreciate this more than your typical shandy, lacks the sugar factor. Makes it more like a real beer instead of lemonade. Good job peter, an example that any maker of a shandy should follow. Nothing artificial in this brew. Good co2 clear to the end. Could drink a few of these with no problem.

Amber-brown with a settling foam, slightly artificial mango, caramel and leafy hops on the nose. The fruit is more restrained on the palate, complementing rather than swamping a dry, pithy-piney and earthy bitterness that speaks of England as much as, if not more than, the new world.

Tap at Hole in The Wall (Raglan outside bar).    Dark brown almost black pour big frothy Guinness like head.  Nose is light earthy chocolate.  Tastes of light malt, rootbeer, roast and hint of dark chocolate.  Thin and dry.   I’m hungover so this is pleasant way to get back into life.

Beer Names: Cloudwater Where Does Your World End and Where Does Mine Begin
Reviews: Bottle from Cloudwater online. Deep and crystal clear amber colour. Aroma floral and spice nutmeg, cinnamon and citrus.  Taste sweet almost honey to slight sour.
Angenehmes, rundes Pils. Leichte Süße, Hauch Zitrusfrucht und dezent herb..
More like a mild english dark beer. Clean and well made, real cask ale flat, but good. GBBF birmingham
Recht langweiliges Bier. Leicht malzig, kann aber etwas unrund nicht überzeugen.

Beer Names: Wellington UVB 76: Roman Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Stout
Reviews:
Glass, 2-ounce, draught, A blackout brunch 'til Monday lunch at Lupulus, savoured on March 3, 2019; eye: brown with a burgundy hue, semi-opaque, ring of beige head, light lacing; nose: coffee, light vanilla, fleeting; palate: coffee, light vanilla, caramel, finale in coffee with a light vanilla presence, medium body, average carbonation, mildly sweet, watery texture and a little bit thin; overall: so?
 

FRANÇAIS
                                                   
Verre, 2 onces, en fût, A blackout brunch ‘til Monday lunch chez Lupulus, savourée le 3 mars 2019; œil : brun avec une teinte bourgogne, semi-opaque, anneau de mousse beige, légère dentelle; nez : café, léger vanille, fugace; bouche : café, léger vanille, caramel, finale en café avec légère présence de vanille, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture aqueuse et un peu mince; en résumé : bof!

Cask at the Euston Tap, London on 6th February 2020. Hazy gold with shallow foam and scant lacing. Zesty citrus aroma. Grapefruit juice and citrus peel in liquid, and a tart citrus finish. Zingy mouthfeel and a fair amount of body.

Botlle. Nose is malty,  dark fruit, plums, raisin. Taste is dark malts, dough, spice, hint of almond, roast, herbal hop not, touch of chocolate in the body with a bitter finish. 

Beautifully balanced.

Bottle. Dark brown color with creamy beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee. Taste is chocolate, coffee, a little bit sour in the end. Silky mouthfeel, quite light, very low carbonation. I liked it, very easy to drink even if a bit too sweet, I would drink more.

Beer Names: Atom / Northern Monk Neutron Death Star
Reviews: Keg @ Northern Monk Refectory, Manchester.  Bumped into Rune and Finn for a sample of this one so thanks to them.  Very dark, feeling about 4% lower than it is in my opinion, making it dangerous tasty, and there's a smoothness to the brew too.

750-ml caged and corked bottle purchased at the brewery in Brossard, Quebec, Canada. Pours pitch black yet with the tiniest bit of mahogany hightlights, along with a trace of brown head and lots of clingy lacing. Aroma: coffee, chocolate, dark dried fruits, smoke. Flavor: espresso, milk chocolate, campfire marshmallows, prunes, raisin bread, date bars, figs, molasses cookies, burnt toast; perfectly balanced between sweet and bitter. Mouthfeel: full-bodied with a velvety smooth, creamy yet oily finish.
A nice real ale cask served, but this one is a bit oxidized and stale. GBBF Winter2020

Clear rich golden with a thick rocky white head. Nice aroma of sticky dank earthy pineapple and a little piney resin. Crisp bright golden malty flavor with nice pineapple and resiny aromas with little bitterness. Smooth and balanced and quaffable.
Cask @ Fox & Goose, Hebden Bridge.  Light golden with a small head.  Hoppy ale with a brooding fruitiness somewhere in the background, and some malty-bitterness in its aftertaste.

On Tap at the Boise brewery/taproom.  Hazy deep orange light amber with a thin wispy soapy of white head.  Some deep resinous piney hops in the aromas and flavors. Big citrus pithiness as well.  Late light malty cereal flavors.   Medium bodies and a little ABV burn in there.

Pours a cloudy, pale golden amber coloration with a small, fluffy head and plenty of tiny particulates suspended in the beer. Smells of quite sweet doughy, biscuity malt and rather floral, grassy hops. Taste follows the nose, being rather dominated by sweet, doughy malt and quite floral, grassy hops, with just a hint of herbal and spicy accents also coming through. Finishes bittersweet, with a medium bitterness and some floral, grassy hops lingering in the aftertaste. Full mouthfeel with a medium/rich body and medium carbonation.

Being quite impressed with everything I've had from Kundmüller before, this came as a bit of a disappointment to me, to be honest. I guess they wanted tro experiment with a dry-hopped Doppelbock and it's just not working for me because it's overly dominated by the quite floral and grassy hops, while the malts add little but sweetness here, that is at least somewhat balanced by the rather distinct bitterness though. Certainly a very different, unique Doppelbock that is very hoppy for the style, but not in a good way, and feels somewhat one-dimensional as well.
500ml bottle.  Pours jet black with a large head.  Aroma is cinnamon and ginger.  Taste is sweet with honey to start with ginger, cinnamon and roast on the finish.

Beer Names: Northern Monk / HOMES / Ology Patrons Project 10.07 Culinary Concepts Fruited Sour IPA
Reviews: Can from To Øl beer club. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma tropical fruity guava and passion fruit. Tart fruity to sweet. Full smooth
Clean classic old English porter, light I’m body, nothing off, clean and mildly roasty. Gbbf 2020

Beer Names: Northern Monk Patrons Project 25.01 Everyday Abstract
Reviews: Can, 7.2%. Hazy yellow with medium off-white head. Aroma is fruit, hops, citrus, pineapple and tropical fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, pineapple, sweet, juice, fruit peel and a little bitter.

Beer Names: Silver Moon Barrel Aged Xul Blend
Reviews: Draught. Pours opaque jet black with a medium, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate rich chocolate, toffee, and caramel malt, sweet cinnamon and vanilla, tobacco notes, dark fruits, and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear, nearly opaque black with a medium, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate rich chocolate, medium roast malt, tart raspberries, and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Beer Names: Berliner Berg It's Been A While IPA
Reviews: Ty Koelschtrinker. Kuldne õlu. Magus, mõru, tsitrus, suhkur, greip, alks. Hea.

16oz draft at Austin airport. Pours a clear bright gold with a tight dense white head. Light bread and grass smells. super crisp lemon zest flavors with an astringent mouthfeel. medium carbonation. Nice.

Draught. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Heavy pine, resin, and tangerine hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Beer Names: Evil Twin I Love You With My Stout
Reviews: Warka #011. Wygląd: czarne, nieprzejrzyste, piana drobno-pęcherzykowa, niezbyt obfita. Aromat mocno czekoladowy, gorzka czekolada, leciutko kawa, minimalnie ciemne owoce. W smaku dobrze zachowany balans pomiędzy słodyczą a wytrawnością. Ponownie dużo czekolady deserowej, ciasteczka Brownie, kawa. Goryczka średnia, palona, nieco kawowa, pozostaje na podniebieniu w postaci popiolowości przez dłuższy czas. Wysycenie niskie, piwo jest pełne i gładkie, alkohol niewyczuwlany. Bardzo dobry stout.
Draught. Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, short retention. Moderate tart and acidic passion fruit, light cracker malt and a dry finish. Light body and carbonation.
Clean cask served real ale sour. Nice and malty and the sourness is perfectly balanced. Gbbf winter 2020

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with spotty lacing. Medium grainy sweet bready malt, light spicy and floral hops and hop bitterness, light sulfur, and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation
Can from the brewery. Golden pour with thin head, pine, grapefruit, a little spice. Nice beer.

0,33 l bottle from Erzengel. Thanks a lot! Unclear golden with a more than two finger steady foamy white head. Tropical fruity smell with some caramel. Taste starts with an intensive hoppy bitterness and yeasty passage. Caramel and dry grain in the second row. Also sticky sweetness. Pleasant bitterness in the aftertaste. Nice.
From a 12 oz can. Pours a clear mahogany with a tan head. Nutty aroma. Flavors are sweet and malty.
A nice classic malty mildy roasty good bodied full filling english mild. Real ale feom gbbf birmingham

Beer Names: AND UNION Neu Blk / Neu Black Lager
Reviews: Cremig, malzig mit einer leicht süßen, brotigen Note. Insgesamt sehr rund, aber auch sehr dezent Richtung Helles.
Hazy orange pour. Fruity and slightly piney nose. Sweet, juicy and slightly bitter. Nice touche of the apricot

16 oz can from Total Wine and More in Short Pump, VA  No brewer name on the label  This was a difficult beer to classify.  Others have it as a Sour -Weisse.  The sour poured a cloudy amber color with a big white head that quickly dissipated.  The sour aroma of beer but really on the best I have had. The sour has a medium body with soft carbonation.  The finish is clean with a mouthfeel of pleasant sourness.

Beer Names: Brauerei Simon Schwarze Kuni Dunkler Weizenbock
Reviews:
Pours a quite cloudy, dark brown coloration with a large, creamy, very stable head and visible carbonation. Smells of doughy, bready, lightly roasted malt and estery yeast notes of banana and clove, with just a hint of chocolate. Taste is a decent balance of doughy, bready lightly roasted and caramelly malt and estery yeast notes of banana and clove, with just a hint of, chocolate and raisins also coming through, as well as a light tartness developing in the aftertaste. Finishes with a light bitterness and some roasted notes, banana, clove and tartness lingering in the aftertaste. Full mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation.

This "Black Weizenbock" certainly lives up to its name, being a lot more malt-focussed than your average Weizenbock, with some lightly roasted, caramel, chocolate and dark fruit notes coming through apart from the typical yeast esters. However, there's also a light tartness to this that seems somewhat displaced here. While the balance seems a little off, this still makes for quite an interesting and enjoyable brew at the end of the day. I would have wished for some stronger roasted notes and could have done without that light tartness though, which I'm not sure is really intended here. Almost seems just a tad oxidized, even though this should be reasonably fresh assuming a one-year best-by date.

Delt med Rune på rom 410 Premier Inn Waterloo, Birmingham. Svart. Middels høyt lysebrunt skum som daler sakte og etterlater litt lacing. Lakrisaroma. Silkemyk munnfølelse. Smaken nøtter & sjokolade. Tørr avslutning. Litt alkohol kommer fram.

Beer Names: Beatnikz Republic I Heart San Diego
Reviews: Nice, floral, grassy, bit citrusy, slightly hazy golden, nice old school IPA, bitter, floral, bit piney, citrusy

Drinking one from the minibar in our room of the Derlon hotel in Maastricht.

Clear golden, slightly amber, with a two centimetre thick head.
Smell of traditional malts and hops with a herbal, buttery note. Rather bland taste for a pils.
There are better beers of this style and unfortunately I have to drink it from a smaller water glass.
Beer with gold color, fuzzy aspect, soft bitterness, soft carbonized, some of foam on top, (shared a 33cl bottle beer with PG, bought at "REWE", Neckarsulm, DE #1096)(#156 DE)(#7 Hamburg).

Draught. Pours clear black with a medium, frothy beige head, long retention. Moderate citrus, pine, and resin hops and hop bitterness, minty notes, roast and chocolate malt with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

Draught at Taphouse.
Black coloured with a small off-white head.
Light roasted aroma of hay and caramel with notes of chocolate and raspberries.
Light roasted flavour of caramel and chocolate with notes of raspberries.
Light roasted finish.

330ml bottle from my Secret Santa 2019. Pours a deep Amber, frothy off white head. Very light toffee aroma. Taste is fairly light, thin bodied with a light caramel touch, bready malt. Fine light sipper but otherwise not a lot going on.

Beer Names: Cloudwater A Scabrous Edge Of The Sky
Reviews: Can at home. Pours hazy orange gold with a decent white head. Aroma is orange, pine hop, melon, grapefruit. Taste is big and juicy. Orange hit, bit of melon, grapefruit and a big boozy pine hit. Dry finish. Nice, fresh and boozy DIPA.

Beer Names: Cigar City Cubano-Style Espresso Brown Ale
Reviews: 35.5cl can at home, bought at Just in Beer. Appearance: dark brown with a medium to big beige head. Aroma: dark roast coffee and coffee grounds, peppery, slight vanilla. Taste: moderate sweetness and fairly high bitterness. Mainly coffee and coffee grounds, with some peppery notes, rye, some licorice root. Palate: medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. Overall: pretty good! even though the body is not too strong, it is perfect for this style.

Draught. Pours clear black with a medium, frothy beige head, long retention. Moderate rich chocolate and roast malt, dark fruits, light earthy hops and hop bitterness and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Thin white head left a spotty cover on an unclear pale gold body.
Minimal tangerine aroma.
Medium bodied, soft on the palate with sharper clean back.
Hoppy tastes with tangerine, peach, confectionery & pith.
Poor.

Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Heavy citrus, tropical fruit, and melon hops and hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
TY Koelschtrinker. Võrdlemisi magus ja linnaseline, väike alks ka. Lõpuks on õrn ekstraktine mörudus. Täitsa  mõnna.

Can. A hazy amber beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of exotic fruits, spices, wheat, and lactose. The flavor is sour with notes of salt, spices, exotic fruits, wheat, and lactose, leaidng to a tart finish.

Draught. Pours clear orange with a large, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Heavy fruity, citrus, and resin hops and hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

473ml can. Hazy, light yellow-ish, bright golden colour with average, thick, frothy to creamy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Piney and juicy fruity, hoppy aroma, notes of pineapple, honeydew melon, spruce, some resin. Taste is juicy, (citrusy) fruity hoppy, notes of orange, mandarine, pineapple, some passion fruit, some pine, rather sugary, sweet, pale malty basis. Slightly watery texture, smooth and soft palate, gentle carbonation. Highly drinkable, refreshing, a tad too sugary sweet.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Moderate rich coffee, chocolate notes, light biscuit malt, and a dry finish. Medium-light body and moderate carbonation.

Bottle 33cl. @home poured into a teku glass. Opaque dark brown, tall creamy macropore tan head, good retention and lacing. Complex aroma roasted malt, liquorice, cherries, raisins, cocoa, wood, herbs, vanille kicks in after a while. Taste light heavy sweet and medium bitter, roasty, chocolate, cherries, raisins, alcohol, herbal notes. Full-bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation, roasty sweetbitter aftertaste, alcohol, very good heavy but well-balanced and tasty, a real sipper.
355ml bottle.  Pours dark gold with a large head.  Aroma is straw, lemon and biscuit.  Taste has straw, biscuit and soapy lemon.  An imported Apa that could be any generic UK supermarket gold.

Handpull cask at the Beer Pharmacie, Syston. Light copper, translucent, with a good-sized off-white head on top. Aroma is malt-dominated, with an earthy breadiness. The initial sweet, malty taste turns to a leafy hop bitter almost immediately, with notes of redcurrants in the aftertaste. Soft carbonation. A basic but enjoyable basic bitter.

Draught. Pours hazy yellow with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Medium acidity and tartness, lime, tamarind, and chili peppers, light cracker malt, and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

Beer Names: Cloudwater / De Garde Blueberry du Haut
Reviews: Bottle from Cloudwater. Abv 7%. Purple to red colour with no real head. Aroma blueberry taste tangy sour. Light body.

On tap at Big Dog's, I assume the pom in the name refers to pomegranate as this had a nice light fruit flavor. Definitely didn't see the 9%.  I liked this quite a bit, but I have a bias towards pomegranate beer.

Beer Names: The Kernel Export India Porter - Hallertau Blanc
Reviews: Keg at the brewery taproom - Bermondsey. Pours black-brown with a frothy, beige head. Rich and ashy roast defines the character, with mellow sweetness supporting, some coffee grounds, scorched earth, toasted pine and orange peel. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Great balance in the finish. Excellent beer.

Beer Names: Hill Farmstead Genealogy of Morals - Coffee (Akmel Nuri) - Rum
Reviews: Bottle at home in Hackney - picked up at the brewery. Pours black-brown with a foamy, beige head. Luxurious and delicious, with lots of layered chocolate character, a bit of chocolate sauce, ripening dark fruits, subtle roast, creamy-sugary coffee. Full bodied, oily and lightly chewy, with fine carbonation. Softly warming finish, almost a little sticky, more more decadent chocolate character, raisins, mellow earthy bitterness, more dense fresh coffee. Has an obscene amount of depth. Makes for a great sipper. Delicious.
On tap at Big Dog's, this was super sweet. The sugar was just off the charts. A bit creamy but just too sweet to enjoy.  A rare miss for Able Baker, imo.

Keg at the Beer Pharmacie, Syston. Dark brown with a ring of khaki/tan head. Milk chocokate, a tpuch of cola nut in the aroma, with less of the advertised salted caramel than I expected although it's still a component. Tastes sweet with toffee notes to the fore, followed by a light hop bitterness in the finish. Liquorice in the aftertaste along with more chocolate and caramel. Light carbonation. While not the most focused beer, it certainly has a pleasant composition.

Beer Names: Hopfenhäcker Isle of Islay Rum Smokey Sten
Reviews: Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A very dark brown beer with a beige head. Aroma of bourbon, rum Barrel, dark roasted malt. Taste of dark roasted malt, coffee, burned malt rum barrel.
Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A slightly hazy yellow golden beer with a white head. Aroma of sweet banana, quite yeasty. Taste of sweet banana, yeast, some phenols, quite sweet.

Sampled @ Braukunst Live 2020. A slightly hazy dark amber beer with a off white head. Aroma of strong caramelized malt, red malt, caramel, honey. Taste of strong caramelized malt, honey, riped fruits, boozy.

Beer Names: Glen Affric Speyside BA Black Brose
Reviews: Puszka. Czarny kolor. Piana beżowa,średnia opada dość szybko. W zapachu raczej nikłe nuty whiskey, można złapać ulotne akcenty beczki i palonej kawy,palony słód. Delikatna tekstura i raczej małe wysycenie przypominają bardziej stouta niż portera. W smaku kawa,delikatna whiskey ,beczkowe nuty,lekki tytoń li skóra. Bardzo fajne...zobaczymy co się stanie po ogrzaniu..chyba tylko więcej goryczki,brykietu i tytoniu..

Pale golden with a white head - Malt aroma with some hops in the back - Malt body with a good hop profile with bitterness to balance - The malt with hop bitterness goes into the finish - This was good
Ty Koelschtrinker. Välimus on läbipaistmatu helekollane. Lõhn ja maitse on magus, viljane, tummine, linnaseline, natuke võine. Hea.

Bottle from my local off license ‘Wine Rack’.
Pours a very hazy amber/orange colour with a large foamy off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruits, citrus fruits, banana, pine, zesty, floral, wheat and grass. Taste is more of the same notes, tropical, citrus, orange, grapefruit, floral, hints of tea with a zesty earthy hop bitterness on the finish. Fair carbonation. Medium bodied with a very slightly oily mouthfeel and a long fruity hop aftertaste. Excellent

On tap at Valhalla Craft Beer Bar, Zagreb. Clear golden to dark golden, small off-white head. Aroma is malty and fruity, cherry with a touch of caramel. Flavour is pleasantly caramely, caramel butter candy, chewy toffee and bread, some vanilla, some herbs.l, some nuts. Light body, moderate carbonation, moderately lasting finish. Good balance. Wonderfully executed.
Can from the brewery. Light grassy hops, floral aroma, pleasantly light bitter finish. Decent.

Medium body, smooth texture, low heat and carbonation, short aftertaste, coffee finish. Moderately bitter, dry, crisp. 
Not my taste.

Beer Names: Cigar City Marshal Zhukov's Imperial Stout
Reviews: Bottle shared by Anders, thanks. Small fluffy brown head. Complex aroma with piny, roasted malty and hoppy aroma. Sweet malty smooth taste. Firm bitternesd.
Amazingly weak body and flavor, but smooth texture, slightly bitter taste and finish. Not bad flavor but not good either.
Clean mild plum, light drinking, full flavored dark mild, nithing overtly off, pretty good. Gbbf winter 2020

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL., and nitro dispensed as a 5 oz. serving showing a cascading effect to the darkest brown color, with some ruby highlighting, a silky layer of tan froth, and spiraling cling to the sheeting lacing. The nose was initially mild, but gradually presented cocoa, slight treacle, cream, sweetness, vanilla, and subtle spices as cinnamon & ginger. Medium bodied, the taste was as the aroma, with the nitro influence fading to nil, but still quite flavorful without the carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear dark brown with a small, frothy beige head, short retention. Moderate rich chocolate, light ginger and sweet vanilla, roast malt, and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear brown with a small, frothy off-white head, short retention. Moderate rich chocolate coffee notes, roast and bread malt, light hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught at Taphouse.
Clear golden coloured with a medium sized white head
Fruity aroma of hops and citrus with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops and citrus with notes of pine needles.
Hoppy finish.

Draught. Pours clear amber with a small, frothy white head, short retention. Heavy meaty smoke aroma and flavor, medium toast malt, light earthy hops and hop bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy off-white head, medium retention with light lacing. Medium grainy and bready malt, medium earthy hops and hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Beer Names: Wylam / Old Chimneys Summon Up The Blood
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml shared with Max, Simon and Miro B. Black, beige head. Chocolate, malty, maple, tonka, vanilla, low carbonation. Sweet with some bitterness in finish. Smooth texture. Medium to full bodied.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Medium acidity, tart peaches, light almond notes, light bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Puszka. Czarny kolor. Piana zbita,beżowa,o średniej wysokości ,ładnie utrzymuje się w szkle. W zapachu mleczna czekolada,lekkie nuty masła orzechowego,kawa Inka. W smaku podobnie ,słodka ,mleczna czekolada,kawa słaba...Inka. ślady wytrawnego kakao..z lekka goryczka. piwo ratuje kremowa konsystencja i bardzo delikatne wysycenie...mimo wszystko jest raczej ok niż wow...

Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy off-white head, medium retention with light lacing. Moderate bitter orange pith hops, medium herbal and savory bergamot, medium biscuit malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Handpull cask at the Syston & District Social Club. Dark gold, clear with a small foamy white head and lots of lacing. Bready notes and brown sugar in the aroma with some notes of melon. Bittersweet taste with suggestions of peach. A bit medicinal in the drier finish. Soft carbonation. It's in optimum condition which brings out some subtleties in a fairly simple beer.

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL. as a 5 oz. serving showing a black/brown hue, with a creamy layer of deep tan froth, and sheeting spray as lacing. The nose was roasted, cocoa, slight coffee, and a touch of caramel sweetness. Medium+ bodied, with fair to low carbonation, the taste was similar, adding a bit of tartness & tanginess, and roasted, earthy bitterness with a dry edge to the finish. Solid, no nonsense, Sweet Stout.

Stone Brewing (Berlin)
Can: 330 ml, at home, from trip to StockholmPrice: 15,9 sek  ~1,51 eur 
neblogai, bet tikėjausi geriau

Beer Names: Pressure Drop / Left Handed Giant Escape Pod
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml shared with Max, Simon and Miro B. Black with beige head. Chocolate, vanilla, coconut, coffee, bit lactic. Smooth. Moderate sweetness, some bitterness in finish.

Beer Names: Orpheus Searching for Flowers on Well-Worn Paths
Reviews: Clear golden colour with thin head. Aroma and flavour have a sharpness just like a sour cider. Gassy. Slight funk too.
on tap-thin retaining white-yellow.  A-slight spice, lt malt/grain.  T-follows, clean.  747414-3.6

Beer Names: City Steam Naughty Nurse Amber Ale
Reviews: Pours a nice copper from a tap. Malty aroma overrun by diacetyl, flavor is primarily fake butter but ends with a fine grainy bitterness. Okay beer, wish it wasn’t such a diacetyl bomb.

Draught at Taphouse.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops and citrus with notes of grass.
Hoppy finish.

Beer Names: Cloudwater The Infinite Sides Of The Globe
Reviews:
Pours a hazy, dark orange coloration with a medium, fluffy head. Smells of light biscuity malt and bright and juicy hoppy notes of grapefruit, passion fruit, white grape and gooseberry, as well as a light, grassy dankness. Taste is an excellent balance of light biscuity malt and quite vibrant hoppy notes of zesty grapefruit, sweet passion fruit and lightly acidic white grape and gooseberry, as well as some grassy dankness. Finishes with a medium bitterness and some passion fruit, grapefruit and white grape lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation.

Another world-class Pale Ale from Cloudwater, with an incredibly vibrant hop character and full body and mouthfeel for the ABV, as well as an excellent balance of sweet, zesty and acidic hoppy fruit notes that lead into a bitter and slightly dank finish, showcasing the Nelson Sauvin and Cascade hops beautifully, with strong white grape and grapefruit notes.
Pours oily black with a creamy tan head. Strong aroma of firewood, dark malts, plum, but mostly smoke. Taste is sweet, roasted malts, again very smoky. Medium body, low carbonation, smooth mouthfeel.

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL. as a 5 oz. serving showing a black/brown hue, with a presentable layer of deep tan froth that reduced to a persistent ring, and foamy dots & dashes of lacing. The nose was roasted, cocoa, char & dryness, with a touch of mint. Medium+ bodied, with fair to low carbonation, the taste was similar, syrupy, including roasted and earthy bitterness, and the slight mint that actually took the edge off the astringency.
Tap. Hazy deep copper color with a medium sized frothy head. Aroma of ripe banana. Medium sour taste. Flavors are bread and banana. Medium to full body.

Beer Names: Brew By Numbers 33 TDH Session IPA - Mosaic Citra Amarillo
Reviews:
Draught at Taphouse.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus and exotic fruits.
Fruity flavour of hops and citrus with notes of white wine grapes.
Hoppy finish.

Can 473ml (Beergium)
Opaque colour, good brownish head. Roasted aroma has coffee, cacao and dark chocolate. Full-bodied. Roasted flavour has lots of espresso, cacao, ash. Not really chillies here. Smooth, hides ABV well. Quite dry, almost too dry.

Puszka. Mętne o brudnym ,żółtym kolorze. Piana biała ,średnia szybko opadła do pierścienia. W aromacie mix tropików,mango,ananas,morele,cytrusy raczej słodkie ,pozostają w tle. W smaku nadal słodko ,mango ,morele ,ananas,liczi ,żółty melon. Jest też nutka cytrusów,różowy grejpfrut ..guma balonowa? Wysycenie małe i  zdradliwe 8 procent...

Kolor bursztynowy, opalizujący. W płynie widać drożdżowe drobiny. Piana biała, wysoka i trwała. Zbudowana z drobnych pęcherzyków.
W aromacie nuty pieprzowe, estry owocowe sporo słodyczy. Słodowość, miód, syrop owocowy, suszone owoce, beczka i odrobina nut waniliowych.
Smak: syrop owocowy, suszone owoce, słodka słodowość i akcenty przyprawowe z pieprzem na czele. Dalej beczka, mokre drewno, i bardzo delikatnie wanilia. Na finiszu goryczka, pestkowa.
Alkohol idealnie ukryty. Wysycenie wysokie, cały czas buzuje w ustach. Ciało wysokie. Piwo jest nieco szorskie.

Pours a deep dark brown almost black colour with a small frothy light beige head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts and milk chocolate with a hint of dried fruit. A moderately sweet smooth roasted malt taste, cocoa powder and burnt malt flavours with a dry slightly alkaline finish. Nice.

Аромат жжёной карамели
Вкус очень приятный, шоколад - хлебная корка - карамель. Отличный портер.

Keg at Micro Beers, Sheen.  Super dark brown with a thick tan head.  Aroma of milk chocolate, cocoa, slight astringent grain and rum.  Very smooth and quite a big date and dark fruit flavour with some vanilla and cocoa.

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL. as a 5 oz. serving showing a clear, deep amber color, with a fluffy layer of tan froth, and sheeting spray as lacing. The nose was expressive dried fruit, cherry & skins, candy sweetness, barrel induced vanilla, and subtle spice. Medium bodied, with fair carbonation, the booze and barrel added decent warmth & astringency, but lessened the lively follow through of the aroma notes. Still got the job done as a presentable winter warmer.

Beer Names: Deschutes Wowza! Lo-Cal Hazy Pale Ale
Reviews: I can't say enough about this 4%, 100 calorie IPA. Obviously it is lighter by definition. But they've crafted it to be surprisingly flavorful and refreshing. It's gotta be a winner for folks that may be averse to traditional IPA bitterness. Very drinkable and the low calories are an added bonus.

Beer Names: Bristol Beer Factory White MIlk Stout
Reviews:
Cask at MS HW, 06/02/20.
Clear golden blonde with a decent white head.
Nose is light coffee bean, airy malts, straw, vanilla, toasted malts.
Taste comprises creamy malts, faint coffee, hint of white chocolate buttons, vanilla, light fruit esters.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, semi drying close.
Passable for the sub genre ... nothing I’d go back to though.

Beer Names: The Kernel Biere de Saison - Sour Cherry
Reviews: Top notch sour, balanced and drinkable. Fruity yet not overly so, and tartness that is world class. GBBF Winter

Im Geruch malzig süßlich. Goldgelbes klares Bier, schnell einfallende grobe Schaumkrone. Der Antrunk ist süßlich hopfig-malzig. Traditioneller Hopfen im Aroma. Sehr mild, kaum bitter. Leichte Säure. Feinperlig. Relativ eintönig, leistet sich jedoch keine geschmacklichen Fehler. Besser als das typische Durchschnitts-Export.

Clear golden with a thin head.
Grainy, yeasty smell with a citric note. Grainy taste. A normal Belgian lager/pils as there are many. Highly drinkable.

Beer Names: Marks & Spencer Maritime Salted Caramel Porter
Reviews: Meantime Salted Caramel Porter 5.5%. Chestnut brown, toffee malt aroma, roasted malt, bitter dark chocolate, toffee, salted caramel. Old school Porter from supermarket Marks and Spencer 🇬🇧

Pours a clear dark brown colour with a small bubbly light beige colour that settled. A rich creamy aroma,  sweet vanilla and toffee fudge. Not overly sweet, smooth and creamy in the mouth, roasted malt, creamy with vanilla flavours and a dryish finish. Quite tasty.

Beer Names: FrauGruber / Dry & Bitter Slaves Of Convenience
Reviews: niesamowite są te chmiele nowozelandzkie, pachnie to jak kwiaciarnia, prawdziwy gewurztraminer wśród ipek - dla mnie bomba, i to w prawie trzymiesięcznej puszce - zero utlenienia.
A lovely beer to drink.The bottle of Copper Dragon Golden Pippin was was purchased at Booths @ Lytham. Recommend 😉

Medium, rather dense just off-white head over finely carbonated totally clear golden beer. Very nice nose, dominated by fruitacids and -esters, bit floral. Peaches are utterly obvious, vinous arrives a bit later. Superbly inviting. Sour, lambic-like barnyard odours. In the taste, the fruitiness is more subdued, but still quite traceable. Faint notes of sulphur, stressing the lambic-likeness even more. Outstanding! Another one Martin T has pointed us to in his book, and with good reason!

Beer Names: North Brewing Co Triple Fruited Gose: Boysenberry
Reviews:
Draught at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade.
Dark brown coloured with a small head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of boysenberries.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of boysenberries.
Tart finish.

Brown with a foamy head that soon turns whispy. Big medicinal aroma, a cherry/raspberry blend cough syrup. Herbal too though. With a bit of time out of the bottle it really does start to smell like a PB&J. The intense peanuty note is probably the highlight of this brew. Taste is bittersweet, full of earthy peanut shell and sweet artificial cough drop. Body is medium, carbonation moderate, texture watery. Probably the most disappointing tough 50 brew I‘ve tried, at least for such a major style.

Keg at MS HW, 06/02/20.
Black with a tan cap that veers edgeward.
Nose is dark malts, cocoa powder, toffee, dried fruits, light charr, mellow roast, light coffee.
Taste comprises sweet malts, chocolate, pecan nut, caramel melt, toffee fudge, light booze tunes, brown sugars, mellow roast.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a balanced rising boost level.
Ok easy drinking impy, ABV considered, but lacks a little depth and struggles to pull out of third gear.
Canned, 440 ml, shared with Max, Simon and Miro B. Unclear orange, medium white head. Smooth, fruity, citrus. orange, lasting bit strong bitter finish. Medium bodied.
