Draught. Pours clear dark brown with a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention. Medium roast and chocolate malt, a clean lager character, light earthy hops and hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Medium grainy sweet malt, light earthy and white wine hops, light hop bitterness, a clean lager character, and a dry finish. Medium-light body and medium carbonation.
Tap. Pours hazy yellow,  small white head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is floral,  tropical,  hint of armpit,  bright, strong. Flavor is light sweet,  light bitter.  Nice.  Medium body

Can from Bine & Vine. Pours clear brassy gold with a large foamy white head. Aroma of citrus, a little tropical, and mildly roasty malt support. Med plus body. Flavor is dankish citrus/pine, mildly roasty malt and notes of tropicals. Gets a bit resinish. Pretty dry. Grapefruit zest notes. Very hoppy. Strongly bitter. Excellent.

Taster at the Mothership. Pours an unclear, red color, with a small, off-white head. The aroma is raspberry, lemon cream, vanilla, and strawberry. Sweet and fruity, with a lovely, mellow tart flavor. Light and remarkably crisp and creamy. This is a fruity and delicious sour.

16 oz. Aroma is chocolate, maple syrup-covered French toast, faint wood, faint Bourbon, faint licorice. Pours a really dark brown to black with a one finger tan head with decent retention. Taste is highly sweet, never cloying, light to moderately bitter, faintly tart, with major maple flavor. Delicious.

12 oz. can purchased at Molly's Spirits in Lakeside, CO. Thanks G-unit! Pours a clear dark ruby color with a large khaki head and great retention. Good lacing. Roasted malt and coffee aroma. The flavor matches the nose, except the coffee flavor is more dominant. Mellow overall due to the added vanilla. Low carbonation. Medium+ body and semi creamy mouthfeel. Smooth.
Clear orange appearance with a beige head. Aroma of berries and light grainy notes. Similar flavor, adding moderate sweetness and minimal bitterness. Light body with a lingering fruity finish. OK.
Tap.  Pours clear pale golden,  small white head,  some lacing . Aroma is field head,  Belgian yeast,  floral,  black pepper.  Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter. Light body.  Nice.
12 ounce can.  Pours almost black with a decent tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, coconut, and nuts.  Taste is chocolate, almonds, coconut, and roasted malt.  Nice.
12 ounce can.  Pours a mostly clear gold with a decent white head.  Aroma of malt, grain, and citrus.  Taste is malt, grain, lemon, and floral.  Pretty good.
Aroma is cherry, licorice, chocolate and little burnt wood. Taste is sweet caramel, molasses and fruit. Bitter backbone of coffee and cocoa. Softer mouthfeel.
Can. Dark brown. Bright, with just a thin head. Toasty, with a coffee aroma. Quite toasty coffee note. Medium bodied brown ale base, with again complementary toasty accents. OK.

Taster at the Mothership. Pours a pale, hazy, yellow color, with a big, frothy, white head. The aroma is lemon, butterscotch, clover honey, roses, and dust. Sweet and chalky, with a lovely, mild bitterness. Light and fluffy, and refreshing.

Can from a Lazy Dog 
Lightly hazy orange gold in color with a decent sized off white head that persists. Bready light butterscotch with pine citrus and earth. A little on the sweet side but not too shabby.

Refrigerated 12 oz. aluminum can, canned November 6, 2019 poured into a glass.  Clear golden with small/medium white head.  Aroma is light orange, medium/light body, medium carbonation, and little lacing.  Taste is orange , vanilla, some coriander, and salt.

Tap. Pours clear reddish mahogany,  small beige head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is roasty,  hint of char, coffee grounds,  toffee,  leather.  Flavor is light plus sweet,  light bitter,  beautiful roastiness. Medium body,  soft mouthfeel.  Lovely.
Cerveza oscura y amarga, con notas de café y tostado, nariz frágil de pocos aromas y leves notas de lúpulo. Desbalanceada, a pesar de su baja graduación (5%) se siente alcohólica y pesada. Regular.
On tap. Juicy tropical aroma. Delicious juicy stone fruit taste. Would get again!
355ml can. Clear copper with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are toasted cereals and barley sugar with fruity and herbal notes. Light to medium body, good carbonation, slick texture.
Tap. Pours clear golden,  small white head,  good lacing.  Aroma is light,  clean,  grain,  hint of grass,  clean.  Flavor is light sweet, light bitter.  Light body.

Beer Names: Tooth And Nail Vim and Valor
Reviews: 500ml bottle. Slightly hazy amber, effervescent bubbles and a thick foamy white head. Flavors are bread, dough, honey and spices with fruity notes. Light to medium body, lively carbonation, slick texture.

355ml can. Almost clear golden with a foamy white head. Flavors are bready cereals, pear, bubblegum and grass with spicy, woodsy and floral notes. Light to medium body, good carbonation, smooth texture.

355ml can. Cloudy orange with a thin foamy white head. Flavors are doughy cereals, mango, grapefruit, guava, grass and alcohol with spicy and piney notes. Medium body, moderate to good carbonation, smooth texture.

Beer Names: Grand River Russian Gun Imperial Stout
Reviews: 473ml can. Dark brown with a foamy beige head. Flavors are chocolate, raisins, molasses, caramel and smoke with herbal notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Beer Names: Bellwoods x Modern Times An Imperial Stout with Coffee
Reviews: 473ml can. Black with a foamy brown head. Flavors are roasted cereals, molasses, coffee, resinous hops and vanilla with fruity notes. Full body, soft to moderate carbonation, silky texture.

Tap. Pours clear golden,  medium white head,  good lacing.  Aroma is grain,  grass,  light citrus,  hint of bread.  Flavor is light sweet,  light bitter,  yeasty.  Light body,  soft mouthfeel.  Interesting.

Beer Names: Steel Reserve Alloy Series Spiked Blue Razz 211
Reviews: Tastes like you would expect from a blue raspberry drink, similar to an icy but not as sweet. Fairly enjoyable
Pours cloudy yellow in color with a white head, ok drinking beer, tastes mildly like cinnamon toast crunch but nothing special, disappointed, tap at brewery.
Chocolate, cocoa powder, dark coffee aroma. Dark brown and mocha head. Definitely a dry, coffee, cocoa, cereal, light bitter hop finish, with only a slight bit of vanilla.

Draught. Pours hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention. Medium grainy and earthy wheat malt, light lemon notes, light jasmine and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

On tap. Pours black with no head. Aromas of roasted malts, alcohol and light coconut. Flavors of only vanilla, sour bourbon, light coconut, and sweet roasted malts. Hmmm... messy compared to the original Midnight, but that doesn’t say much...
Interesting concept beer. Not enough of the farmhouse yeastin aroma or flavor. Nice reddish pink without looking too colorful. Flavor is very real-life. Tap at brewery.
Jesus this is bad. Not sure what discriminates this from their lager, taste very similar with harsh grainy notes, corn, acetaldehyde. Light bitterness.

Beer Names: Backcountry Are You Suggesting Coconuts Migrate?
Reviews: On tap. Pours black with light head. Aromas of dry coconut, vanilla and slick roasted malts. Flavors are Bounty. Very nice coconut stout. There should be a style...
Pours dark brown, aroma and upfront taste is a brownie but way too much smoke and charcoal flavor at the end, tap at brewery.
16 oz can at Austin City Limits. Pours a pale amber with a dense white head. Tons of lacing. Big citrus fruit scents. Juicy flavors with a dry mouthfeel. Excellent IPA.
Pours an amber with thick white head and heavy lacing.  Lots of malt on the nose.  Mouthfeel is very heavy with pronounced bitterness.  Nuts, molasses and some metal taste.  Lasting bitter finish.

Can from the brewery. Pours opaque orange/gold with a frothy white head. Tastes like smooth resin, oats, booze, grapefruit hops, and biscuit malt. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like biscuit malt, oats, resin, grapefruit hops, and faint booze.
Pours copper bronze with a big foamy head that last wells and leaves ample lacing; melon, stone fruits, citrus and fruitcake on the nose; bitter oily palate with alcohol present in the finish.

Beer Names: Dogfish Head American Beauty Hazy Ripple IPA
Reviews: Aroma has some funk. Taste also has some funk, but a lot of sweet grapefruit and oranges. Nice but slightly off for style. Can.
16oz can. Milky light orange beige with a thick sticky sandy head.  Lots of light bready cereal malts.  Some sweetness and tropical juiciness but a lot of old grass and papery flavors. Strange
Nice hops bitter flavor and palate. Hazy deep yellow. Aroma is hops with some lactose. Flavor is sweet and fruity. Tap at brewery
Pours dark black, aroma a nice mix of malts and sweet vanilla, nice malt body with a sweet vanilla-forward taste, well done, tap at brewery.

Light Niagara grape aromas and taste. Fun and different but more of a hazy ipa and less of an aged flavor. Maybe it needed to be aged longer. Great beer, but not 100% to the planned style. Tap at brewery

Bomber from The Davis Food Co-op. Pours cranberry juice color with a pink, transient head. Aroma is cider with black currant - my nose isn't picking up cranberry. Med minus body. Flavor is tart cranberry, apple skin and black currant. It's tart, but the currants add some offsetting sweetness. Decent, drinkable.

375 mL bottle. Pours clear and pale yellow. Smells of lemon, grain, lots of cardamom. Tastes of cardamom too. Grainy and light lemon lime tartness. Honey lingers in the finish. Dry and light. Well carbonated. It's good, but very light in all aspects.  It's very possible I would really dig this in a different setting, but it's not doing it for me here.

Finally getting around to this a couple months late. Pours near black with frothy brown foam that settles to a thin cap, moderate lacing. Aromas are simpler than expected, mostly sweet malt, mild ginger snap and a touch of coffee. Flavors bring a vanilla sweetness to the forefront, combining with the roast character, and not much in the way of ginger snap. Very pleasant and easy drinking smoothness. Medium-light mouthfeel and a fairly clean finish. Will try again next year for sure!

On tap at Das Beer Garden. Black and a little transparent at the edges. Smells of bourbon, oak, earthy coffee. Tastes of bourbon, sweet chocolate, coffee, oak. Vanilla and sugar lingers. Big, boozy, heavy, and sweet. But it's very flavorful. I don't often enjoy beers like this, but this is excellent.

Clear light golden appearance with a small white head. Mild aroma of zesty hops, toasted grain and a light herbal spice. Similar flavor, adding mild to moderate bitterness and light sweetness. Light body with a slight watery finish. OK.

Beer Names: Hill Farmstead Leaves of Grass: Dubbel
Reviews: 375 mL bottle. Pours deep amber with a khaki head. Smells of red wine, slight bready malts, oak, some fruity yeast. Tastes tart up front. Gives way to some brown bread with dark fruit yeast flavors. Then red wine sourness kicks back in with an oaky finish. I didn't know if this was going to be sour, but I thought it might. I'm not sure I'm happy that it is, though. I kinda wanted to see if they could make a nice dubbel. It's pleasant, but not what I really wanted from it.

Beer Names: Wild Leap Vacanza Coconut Cream Pie
Reviews: From a can. Pours a cloudy copper with an off white head.  Aromas are of pineapple and coconut. Flavors are tart and fruity.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours black with a khaki head.  Smells of aggressive grassy hops and strong roasted malt.  Tastes of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee bitterness immediately, slight malty sweetness, and some grassy and spicy hop bitterness.  Medium body and remarkably drinkable.  This is wonderful.

The body is a clear, dark caramel color. No head. Aroma is strong caramel and salt, and some dark stone fruits. Taste is fairly salty and tart, a touch of fruit sweetness at the end. Texture is crisp and fizzy.

Tap. Pours clear black,  small beige head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is light,  roasty,  mocha,  ash, more roast. Flavor is light plus sweet,  lighter bitter,  roasty.  Medium body,  soft mouthfeel,  low carbonation.

Beer Names: Foreign Objects From Stardust to Thoughtform
Reviews: (Can) Cloudy, pale yellow body with a medium off-white head. Aroma of pineapple, orange, grapefruit, peach; slightly herbal. Medium body, soft carbonation. Fruity flavor, dusty; long herbal aftertaste.

Draught. Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy off-white head, long retention with good lacing. Moderate fruity and pine hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium bread and dough malt, light alcohol, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Beer Names: Creemore Springs Mad & Noisy Coconut Porter
Reviews: 2020/02/05 - Pours bear black with a foamy, light tan head that quickly reduces and leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is toasted malt, cereal grain, coffee, hints of caramel and semisweet chocolate. Taste is more toasty cereal malts, semisweet chocolate and coffee. No real coconut to speak of. Mouthfeel is medium and slick with smooth carbonation and a toasty, grainy finish. Ok.

Draught. Pours clear black with a large, creamy tan head, long retention with excellent lacing. Moderate rich roast and coffee malt, medium pine and resin hops, moderate hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation.

Tap. Pours clear hazel,  small beige head,  decent lacing.  Aroma is roast,  nutty,  dark toast,  a hint of wood,  earth.  Flavor is light plus sweet,  minimal bitterness,  nice roasty notes.  Medium body,  smooth. Good.
Draft at BJ's in Huntsville. Pale Gold color with a nice white head and solid lacing. Hoppy aroma with a pepper spiciness.

Tap. Pours hazy golden orange,  small off white head,  some lacing.  Aroma is light,  armpit,  coconut,  odd. Flavor is light plus sweet,  very light bitter,  green coconut.  Light plus body,  low carbonation.  Ug
Tap. Pours clear golden,  small white head,  good lacing.  Aroma is grain,  citrus,  a bit floral.  Flavor is light sweet,  light plus bitter.  Light body.
I smell fresh grains, lemon, yeast & fresh lumber. clear brown-green tinged yellow. still a little bready flavor, but strong citrus-lemony wiht grapefruit peel. a little hin on the palate

Draught. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing. Heavy pine and resin hops, grapefruit hops, moderate hop bitterness, medium white cracker malt, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Beer Names: Cascade Lakes Crimson Dawn Red Ale
Reviews: Draught. Pours clear amber with a large, frothy off-white head, long retention with excellent lacing. Moderate pine and resin hops and hop bitterness, medium bread malt, and a dry finish. Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Beer Names: August Schell Shift Happens No. 1 DDH Lager
Reviews: 16 oz can pours an almost clear deep golden color with lasting off-white head that leaves some lacing.  Aroma has pine, apricot, lemon, citrus hops, and sugar.  Taste is sweet, despite the hoppiness.  Body is medium to full with perfect carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel.  I was surprised to see Schell's try something like this and sold in 16 oz. four-packs.  The can says "A transitional miniseries in four parts", so I hope to find the subsequent episodes.

Black pour with a fizzy tan head and spots of lacing .... aroma of cocoa, molasses, dark roasted malts, toffee and dark fruits among with caramel malts .... taste is of toffee, roasted malts, dark fruits, cocoa, molasses and caramel malts with licorice .... some leather .... little bitter on the back end and sweet .... finish has licorice, cocoa and toffee .... solid beer for the style, good balance, thick, oily and a great sipper

Draught. Pours clear dark brown with black hues and a medium, frothy off-white head, short retention with light lacing. Medium roast and chocolate malt, medium earthy and floral hops, medium hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
16 oz can in 4 pack. Dark golden color - cloudy. Hoppy, pine-like aroma.  This is a good one. Very hoppy, moderately good flavored hops.

Draft at Bru Craft. Opaque black pour with a low dense light brown head. Coffee. Dark cocoa. Cinnamon. Ginger. Vanilla. Nutmeg. Hazelnut. Molasses. Burnt marshmallow. Soft nose when cold. Broadens as it warms. A nice Christmasy version of the original.

Beer Names: Evil Twin I Always Felt Closer to IPAs Than I Did to People (9%)
Reviews: Hazy golden color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of slight sweet malt, floral/pine hops, tropical fruit, some grass, & citrus; Flavor of malt, some yeast, caramel, pine hops, tropical fruit, and juicy citrus; Finish is dry & fairly bitter; Nicely balanced; Really nice.

Aus der Flasche (bbe 23.06.2020) im 2020-02 getrunken. Dieses Stout besitzt eine deutlische Kaffeenote und Aromen von einem MARS-Riegel. Überraschend ist das doch volle Aroma bei diesem niedrigen Alkoholgehalt.

Rich dark brown/black color; Medium to heavy slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted/charred sweet malt, vanilla, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, & anise/licorice; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel/vanilla, dark chocolate, espresso/coffee, black licorice, and bourbon; Warm finish; Nicely balanced; Pretty intense overall - good.

Rich black color; Medium to heavy creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, cinnamon, pumpkin, & nutmeg/spice; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel, pumpkin, molasses, cinnamon, nutmeg, and some vanilla; Warm finish; Nicely balanced; Not one over the top - very nice.

Beer Names: Jack's Abby Framinghammer - Barrel Aged Coffee
Reviews: Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, toffee/caramel, & some bourbon notes; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel/toffee, dark chocolate, coffee, some dark fruit, and licorice; Warm finish; Nicely balanced; Nice sipper - enjoyable.

Beer Names: Cascade Lakes Pure Dead Brilliant Maple Scotch Ale
Reviews: Draught. Pours clear dark brown with a medium, creamy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Moderate rich caramel and toasted bread malt, light nuttiness, light alcohol and earthiness, and a sweet finish. Full body and light carbonation with medium alcohol warmth.

Nice dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, rich dark chocolate, cocoa, & some coffee; Flavor of roasted/smoked malt, dark chocolate, coffee/espresso, hops, and some caramel; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Very good.
Draft pour. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of foam. Sweet, grassy, and a bit earthy. Dry, finish. A little spicy. Lighter body and medium carbonation.
Bottle from Ambleside Wines, Ambleside.  Golden with a head.  It has a decent pale ale aroma, but fails to follow through in taste with just a bland hoppiness available.

[Draught at Tapworks Pub] Pours a murky yellow-gold with an average size lasting frothy white head. Nice hoppy aroma, citrusy, piney and herbal, along with tropical fruit and sweet bready malt in the background. Nice flavour as well, follows the aroma, along with an average bitter finish. Medium bodied. This surprised me with how good it is.
Cask @ Fox & Goose, Hebden Bridge.  Golden with a small head. It has an ordinary hoppy nose but is full of cucumber in its taste that lingers.  The style of the ale is redundant for it.

Pours a deep, dark brown with a finger of tan foam that settles to a ring, no lacing. Aromas of roast malt and a slight sweetness. Flavors are more abundant with a nice sweet toffee dominating among biscuit and mild nut presence. This is how I like brown ales - with low hop bitterness and focus on the malt. Well done!

Aus der Flasche im 2020-02 getrunken. Diese kupferne Ale ist typisch im Englischen Stil und hat neben einer Karamellnote eine feine Hopfennote. EIn Ale was einfach Spaß im Glas macht ohne zu kompliziert zu werden.

Beer Names: Woodland Empire Running on the Spot
Reviews: On Tap at the Boise brewery/taproom  Crystal clear deep golden with a touch of orange.  Thin wispy off white skin od micro bubbles. Faint very light pale malts in the aroma.  big grassy floral hop character. Feels pretty light for 7%  Well attenuated.  LIght clean finish.

Hazy deep yellow with small white head.  Aroma hay, citrus and tropical fruit.  Medium body.  Mildly bitter, some sweet juice but more on the grassy than fruit bomb side.  Found this one with a bit more intensity of flavor than their other offerings.
Can into tulip. Nice straw color with some haze. Pineapple and pine notes. Mild bitterness. Decent.

Copenhagen 26/12 2018. 35,5 cl bottle from Voldby Købmandsgård Webshop. This is the 2016 release with an ABV of 11,9. The Classic label with the tagline “Is good for everything a flavoured stout ought to be good for”.

Pours opaque dark brown with small beige head. Settles as thin, transparent layer of foam unable to cover the surface of the beer. 

Aroma is very intensive, sweet with a nice boozy backbone. Sweet chocolate and caramel. Like coming into a candystore offer9ng Classic chocolates. Shoe cream, vanilla, coffee. Powerful alcohol lurking in the background. 

Low carbonation. Thick, oily and creamy texture. Have to work a bit to get it out of the glass. 

Flavor is heavy sweet. Followed by more moderate bitterness. Aftertaste is long and sweet with a spicy undercurrent. Lingers for a long sweet while. 

This is a very nice, very sweet and very strong Imperial Stout. A metal in it-selskab - but I would not dare to drink it for Breakfast.

Beer Names: Lost And Grounded / Cloudwater / Burning Sky The Parrot Lounge
Reviews: Can from Londis, Knighton, Leicester. Dark brown, practically black. A tiny uneven layer of light brown head. The aroma is quite delicate and complex, with notes of liquorice, molasses, cough syrup. Bittersweet, chalky taste with more liquorice and some stone fruit. Medicinal bitterness in the finish. Soft carbonation. Very well put together.
Yellow-orange, small white head.  Aroma is straightforward hops and malt, medium light body.  Flavor is mildly bitter, some malt balance, some citrus and pine, generic and acceptable.
Had poured from bomber-size bottle. Sparkling amber-gold with a fizzy white head.  Smells of fruit - plum/peach. Taste is sweet, mildly bitter - fruity nuance a little boozy, a bit tart but not sour.

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL. served to a tulip showing a cloudy, orangey/gold color, a fluffy layer of soft white froth that slowly reduced to a ring, with foamy spots of lacing. The nose was soft grain, citrus as orange & lemon/lime, a bit of pit fruit, tartness & tanginess, and some agave sweetness. Medium bodied, with decent spritz to the effervescence, the taste was similar, with amped tartness & tanginess, a bit of earthy astringency, and light salinity to the finish. Very palate appealing. Like it when the flavor equals or outshines the aroma.

Copenhagen 14/10-2015. 50 cl from draft at Søernes Ølbar. 

Pours dark brown - almost black with small light beige head. 

Aroma is of chocolate and coffee. 

Soft carbonation and creamy palate. 

Taste is very well balanced between sweetness which is not too sugary and rich coffee bitterness. You can sense the quite prominent intensity from the alcohol. 

A very nice imperial stout you are forced to enjoy at a thoughtful pace.
Cloudy orange yellow.  Grassy hop aroma.  Medium body.  Alcohol well hidden.  Mildly bitter, touch of citrus and herbal hops.  It's fine.  Unmemorable.

Hazy yellow, small white head.  Aroma on the malty side.  Medium light body.  Some up front bitterness then gets a bit sweet but without the hop intensity to balance, but finishes a little better on the dry side.  Decent, style not really as advertised.

Beer Names: Stone Viking Space Probe Double IPA
Reviews: Had on tap at Tenaya Creek, this was delicious. Quite hazy, a ton of grapefruit flavors with a little orange.  This is the Stone quality I remember but had been missing in some recent average beers. This one is top notch! Tasty tasty.

Beer Names: Skyline Beer Wise Guide Brown Ale
Reviews: Dark brown with small tan head.  Aroma roasted and sweet malt.  Medium light body.  Flavor is off dry, lightly sweet malt with toasty finish.  Solid.

Beer Names: Coronado / Pizza Port South Of The Pier
Reviews: This was a pretty run of the mill.  Not a ton of bittering hops, okay flavor.  Nothing special or memorable.

Poured a hazy, light yellow colour with a bright white, creamy head. Minimal lacing. Light bouquet on the nose. With scents of cereal and light hops. First swig was really quite thin with watery flavours of very light hops, honey and a little nuts. Finish is quite plain with minimal lingering flavours.

Acquired a can in a trade with tfontana, thanks Tom! Can date of 1-23-20. Aroma shows apricot, peach, house yeast. Surprised at the lasting grassy note through the melon and fruit. Texture has a massively juicy center that turns dry. Alcohol is not here. Well above average!
Cherries and lime and not too sour.  Perhaps the extra alcohol helps, because I found this more drinkable than most in this style.

An American Lager with no bitter aftertaste. Clean but not overpowering Lemon and Ginger flavor. A Light & Crisp finish. Doesn't weigh you down. Perfect for a warm afternoon or just relaxing at home or with your friends. High Recommended if you are an America Lager Fan.
Pours clear yellow with average head. Medium body with average carbonation. Taste of fruit with dry finish. Well balanced hops. Has a bit strange after taste.

Beer Names: Crooked Stave Nightmare On Brett (Aged on Leopold Bros Whiskey Barrels)
Reviews:
Glass, 2-ounce, draught, A blackout brunch 'til Monday lunch at Lupulus, savoured on March 3, 2019; eye: dark brown, opaque, no effervescence, beige head, light lacing; nose: acidity, light roast, light fruity, light cherry; mouth: acidity, light roast, light fruit, light cherry, berry pungency, finale in berry pungency with presence of acidity, medium body, average carbonation, slick texture; overall: correct
 

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 2 onces, en fût, A blackout brunch ‘til Monday lunch chez Lupulus, savourée le 3 mars 2019; œil : brun foncé, opaque, pas d’effervescence, mousse beige, légère dentelle; nez : acidité, léger torréfaction, léger fruité, léger cerise; bouche : acidité, léger torréfaction, léger fruité, léger cerise, âcreté de petits fruits, finale en âcreté de petits fruits avec présence d’acidité, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, texture coulante; en résumé : correct
Pours pale yellow with average white head that leaves lacing behind. Aroma of citrus and taste of what with low dry hoppy finish. Nice.

Cloudy brownish orange, small white head.  Aroma of unexciting malt and hops.  Medium body.  Tastes better than the aroma would lead you to expect, decent but not over the top bitterness and a good mix of citrus hops and some malt, quite drinkable.

Dark brown with small tan head.  Aroma chocolaty malt and dark fruit.  Medium light body.  Lightly sweet flavor.  It's somewhat on the lighter and fruitier style for a stout, not necessarily a bad thing, although somewhat lacking in richness.
Chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, cinnamon and cardamom, pitch black, taste is chocolate, cinnamon and cardamom, can't see the rose to be fair, roasted malt, coffee and bit ashy finish, creamy.

Beer Names: Great Divide 25th Anniversary Big Yeti Imperial Stout
Reviews: (can) clear, very dark brown colour with a small brown head; rich aroma of nuts, chocolate liqueur; rich, balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish

Fresh can, pours a murky, but not soupy orange color with creamy head. Nose and flavor are Mango, residual sugar, lime, grape, fruit punch, orange blossom honey, and a touch of astringent booze in the finish. ITs pretty juicy and better than most doubles, but I think it needs a good 4-6 weeks like most cans. Medium bodied.

Beer Names: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Midnight Orange
Reviews: 500 ml bottle. Pours oily pitch black with small brown head. Aroma of hazelnut, bourbon, biscotti, chocolate and orange peel. Taste of bourbon, dark chocolate, orange peel, biscotti and hazelnut.

Tap at butcher and barrel cincinnati. Gold  with medium white head and good lacing 
 . Floral hop nose. Taste is floral, with good complex hop hit. Sticky and lightly fruity finish. A good west coast 
IPA.

Bottle from Cask & Flask in San Jose, CA. Aroma is stewed apples, stewed cherries, cinnamon, brandy. Taste is stewed dark fruit, brandy-soaked apples, maybe some chocolate. You can taste the brandy but also can't believe how well the ABV is hidden. A very pleasant sipper, especially in the wake of the KC Chiefs Sports Ball Win!

Bottle from Beers Of Europe. Hazy golden/amber body with a thick off-white head. Low carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of copper and brown bread. Flavour of wood, grain and weak tea. Thin to medium body with a smooth mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Good flavour.
Sample at P house, hazy orange with an average head. Notes are skunk, onions, cheese hops, candied citrus, and toast. Light bodied with active carbonation

Draft at Bru Craft. Unexpected cloudy amber pour. Slim coat of soft off-white foam. No lace. Malty brew with some dark citrusy hops and faint florals. Poppyseed bagels. Cassia. Tangelos. Cloves. Not sure I have the right beer. Had them check and they assured me it's the right keg. Feels vaguely Belgian but not like a Saison at all.
Aroma 7. Appearance 4. Taste 7. Palate 3. Overall 13. Peanut butter and hazelnut aroma. Taste is peanut butter and sweet. A hint of roasted malt and amount of peanut butter aftertaste.

Can from Cask & Flask in San Jose, CA. Aroma is earthy chocolate, mild coffee, maybe some vanilla cream (less coconut). Taste is smooth chocolate, salt is understated but "feels" like it evens out the taste a bit... not getting much coconut and actually I'm okay with it being more underdeveloped (again, like the salt, probably adds to the overall sum). Pretty solid although not especially memorable.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1617) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear dark brown to black beer, thick dense creamy beige head, stable, non adhesive. Aroma: nice roast, lots of chocolate, coffee, very intense, lovely beer! MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: good roast, alcohol, chocolate, nice bitterness, sweet. Aftertaste: hoppy, dry, good roast, some alcohol, bitter finish, good one!
Can in a trade with tfontana, thanks Tom. Light palate and crisp with a bigger yeast presence than expected. Malt backbone was Pilsner-like with some mild sweetness.

Can from Cask & Flask in San Jose, CA. Aroma is tart berry, some unripe peach, hazy juice vibes coming through. Taste is tart, def getting some of the blueberry which is nice, and then goes more juicy hazy peach (but not overly so). A nice tart IPA if you're in the mood for that sort of thing.

W aromacie na pierwszy plan rzuca się czekolada deserowa, później lekki miód ale chili niewyczuwalne. W smaku zdecydowanie słodkie bez jakiejkolwiek goryczki. Uczucie w ustach pozostawia lekki posmak alkoholowy ale naprawdę minimalny. Podsumowując bardzo zaskakujące pod względem zapachu w którym przewyższa czekolada nad kawa zbożową. Polecam z całego serca.

Beer Names: The Bruery Now Serving: Cherry Pie
Reviews: Can from Cask & Flask in San Jose, CA. Aroma is cinnamon, cherry syrup, some chocolate. Taste is chalky cinammon, more cherry (sometimes natural / sometimes artificial), chocolate malts. Overall I went back and forth on this one... def better as it warmed but initial impressions were that it was a bit heavy on the cinnamon and sometimes tasted a bit cherry adjunct-y.

This APA poured a hazy, light yellow colour with a bright white, creamy head. Nice lacing. Scents include corn, cereal and a little cooked veggies. First swig was a little thin but nice in the flavour dept. Flavours of corn, malt and light hops. Finish is lightly bitter with that corn flavour lingering.

Bottle from Cask & Flask in San Jose, CA. Aroma is tart unripe fruit, some spicy funk, apricot, oaky. Taste is spiced dry fruit (apricots), fuzzy funk, crisp and tart with dry oak. This was solid but I was expecting something a little more extra special from this awesome brewery team-up.

Sampled at P house, didn't know Bolero was making real beer styles that don't cause diabetes. Clears golden with medium head. Not as bad as i expected it would be but theres some champagne type yeast notes and a touch of weird spice. Still happy to see a non lactose, pesticide fruit ridden, offering from BS.

27/IX/19 - on cask @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1610) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Pretty cloudy amber to beige beer, practically no head. Aroma: very malty, grains, hay, lots of cow fodder. MF: soft carbon, medium to light body. Taste: pretty malty, grains, hay, cow fodder, meh. Aftertaste: pretty watery, very thin, not a lot of flavour, alas... Don't like it.
14 oz draft. Flavor has a lot of citrus. Grapefruit, oranges, lemons. Mild mild back bone that gives a mild sweeter note. Some juicy texture without much bitterness. Yes this is proper.

Beer Names: Knotted Root Thick Strawberry Goo: Double Vanilla
Reviews: Hazy orange appearance with pink hues and a white head. Enticing aroma of strawberry jam, fresh vanilla, tart fruits, mild funk and light grain. Similar flavor, juicy, tart and sweet with pleasant acidity. Light body with a refreshing strawberry finish. Wow.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1609) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Pretty clear red brown beer, small creamy beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: very malty, lots of cow fodder, grains, hay, some caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, caramel, malty, alcohol, soft roast, chocolate. Aftertaste: malty, grains, soft roast, bitter and dry finish.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1608) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Pretty clear blond beer, big creamy irregular white head, unstable, bit adhesive, leaving some lacing in the glass. Aroma: nice, tropical fruits, interesting, very hoppy, love it! MF: lively carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter start, resinous, grapefruit, very hoppy, bit sourish, lemony touch. Aftertaste: bitter, dry, grassy, bit malty, meh, underwhelming. Had more potential judging from the smell.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1607) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear dark brown to black beer, small beige head, almost non existing, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: nice roast, lots of caramel, sweet impression, bit dusty, vanilla, caramel notes. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very floral, lavender, soapy bitterness. Aftertaste: very bad, soft roast, alcohol, pretty dirty, don't like it at all.

Dark brown appearance with a lingering tan head. Aroma of caramel malt, chocolate, mild oak, light bourbon and hints of fruit. Similar flavor, rich, malty and layered with lingering sweetness, a full body and a warming finish. Very nice.
Can from Cask & Flask in San Jose, CA. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, mild espresso. Taste is chalky / oaty (but smooth), kinda wet chocolate. Pretty smooth and chocolate-y.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1606) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Pretty clear orange to blond beer, bit creamy white head, stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: dirty, grains, malty, boring. Lacking the typical banana for me... MF: ok carbon, medium to light body. Taste: bit watery, yeast, soft acidity, bit fruity, meh. Aftertaste: little bitter, very yeasty.

Draft at Bru Craft. Foggy reddish orange pour with a slim dense cover of soft off-white foam. Gently tart. Cherries and oak up front. Plums. Raspberries. Currants. Kaffir lime leaves. Feels like real fruit. Juicy but not quite full. Modestly complex. Dry balanced finish.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1605) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear dark brown to black beer, creamy dense beige head, stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very malty, grains, hay, cow fodder, soft roast, unimpressive. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: soft roast, malty, very bitter, dry, bit sourish, nice and malty.

Imperial ipa de 8,2 % abv pour 16,8 ° plato, et 73 ebu.
Houblonnage en chinook, citra et amarillo, avec dry hopping.
Mon exemplaire avait 7 mois de bouteille, soit l'âge idéal (pour le style).
Couleur orangé abricoté, avec un léger voile.
Bulles fines, partout, à montée lente.
Mousse blanche, soyeuse, stable à 2 mm.
Arômes de lichee, bergamote, carambole, pointe de jasmin.
1ère bouche souple, à la superbe entame maltée et veloutée.
Arrière-bouche à l'amertume fantastique fruits/houblons/résine.
2ème bouche à la grande définition de l'amertume.
Arrière-bouche avec agrumes, fleurs blanches et résine.
Longueur qui travaille l'amertume pour l'accorder en plus à la 
texture qui devient très structurée et ferme.
Jambes à fins flocons, longues.
Levure fine, précise, belle ligne.
Alcool très bien, il travaille l'amertume en connaisseur .. et pour le
dire plus clairement .. en connoisseur !!
Finale qui dit que je serais bien élyséen ...
CONCLUSION : grand travail que cette imperial ipa, trouvée à Lille …
On se demande parfois où va le monde, dans la poussière de l'espace !!

473ml can. Hazy, orangey, bright golden colour with average, frothy, osteoporosing, minimally lacing, white head. Juicy, fruity, minimally grassy, hoppy and oaty, malty aroma, rather unspecific fruitiness, some tropical fruit, some yellow stone fruit. Taste is juicy, tropical fruity hoppy, notes of mango, passion fruit, some guava, papaya with a tart-ish touch, dry, oaty malty basis. Very nice, refreshing.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1604) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

PRetty cloudy yellow beer, dense creamy white head, little stable, adhesive, leaving some lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots of dank hops, tropical fruits, coconut, very nice! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, quite some coconut, fruity, lots of dank hops, pretty bitter. Aftertaste: hoppy, dank, fruity, super hoppy, bit resinous, lovely stuff!
Multiple 16 ounce cans served at the brewery. Flavor comes off danky and mild citrus like, maybe white grape hints. Some straw, bready malt. Bitterness is mild. Pretty good balance. Above average.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1603) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear orange beer, small creamy white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: pretty fruity, nice and hoppy, resinous, very nice! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bit malty, very cheesy, resinous hops, super bitter, dry, citrus notes. Aftertaste: malty, grains, hay, cow fodder.

5/2/2020. Bottle courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed. Poured clear pale gold, quite flat with a few short lasting bubbles. Aroma of citrus, baked apples and a slight touch of spice. Moderate sweetness, medium tartness. Moderate body, oily texture, still carbonation. Dry, tart, slightly acidic vinegary finish.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1602) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear orange beer, small creamy white head, stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very malty, grains, hay, cow fodder, grains, oxidized. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very malty, soft bitterness, grains, cow fodder, meh. Aftertaste: slightly sourish, hay, grains, animal fodder, meh.

Not sure exactly which style to put this under, but the combination and the adjuncts sweetened up this level and basically made it taste a bit like creme brulee.  Sweet, but good, but sweeter than what I was craving last night.

Hazy golden appearance with a white head. Aroma of mango, tart fruits, sour funk and a light oaky spice. Similar flavor, juicy, tart and fruity with lingering acidity. Medium to light body with a pleasant finish. Nice!
Almost at end of fresh date so probably should try a fresh one.  Minimal citrus aroma. Very sweet up front.  Some orange juice.  Earthy bitterness is flat.  Slick mouth feel

Pale orange appearance with slight haze and a small white head. Aroma of stone fruit, farmhouse funk, mild oak and light earthiness. Similar flavor, fruity, tart and funky with pleasant acidity. Medium to light body with a nice finish.

Cask at Lych Gate, Wolverhampton

Got a weak spot for this beer, as it is the one which made me realise how good a porter can be – all those many years ago.

Pours completely black with a small cream head and good lacing.  Has a nice complex aroma of treacle and dark fruits.  In the mouth it has a sweet creamy texture with tastes of toffee and roasted malts.  Finish is bitter with some fruitiness.  Nice, but not as good as I remember it being.

16 oz draft at the brewery. Holy shit pineapple!  I love the aroma! A soft touch of pine in the finish. Soft herbs. Lower bitterness level. After drinking a bunch of this it becomes a little rindy and pulppy. Just ok for me.

Pale golden appearance with a white head. Aroma of farmhouse yeast, toasted grain, mild esters, light funk and a light oaky spice. Similar flavor, adding mild sweetness, light acidity and light bitterness. Light to medium body with a slight dry feel and refreshing finish. Good.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1597) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear dark brown beer, small creamy beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: nice roast, malty, grains, hay, cow fodder, sweet, lots of caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium to light body. Taste: very malty, grains, hay, cow fodder, soft bitterness, soft roast.

Color naranja oscuro, turbia, translúcida. Espuma blanca de un dedo de espesor y corta retención. Aroma intenso a fruta de hueso muy madura, melocotón sobre todo, caramelo y ligera miel. Sabor a melocotón, licor, resina y leve pomelo, final medio largo ligeramente dulce y de intenso amargor resinoso y cítrico, alcohol presente aunque no molesto, por lo menos no demasiado. Textura semioleosa. Carbonatación baja.

Cask at Hogshead, Wolverhampton.

Pours almost black with a tight cream head.  Nose has a hint of chocolate, but not much else.  In the mouth it has a creamy texture with coffee and cherries featuring in different areas.  Finish is creamy and slightly bitter.  Extremely drinkable.

27/IX/19 - 75cl bottle @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1595) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Pretty cloudy red brown beer, no head. Aroma: sourish, funky, caramel, berries. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very sourish start, some vinegar notes, citrus, lemony, quite some wood. Aftertaste: sourish, lots of berries, vinegar, dry, lemony.

Draft at the brewery. Pitch black in color. Flavor shows some complexity. Char, earthy green, chocolate, red grapes, prune juice. The body is about normal for a porter. Overall good amount of drink ability.
Box @ Golden Lion/Tor Beers, Todmorden.  My last purchase of 2019.  Peach-amber coloured with a slightly dank appearance.  Blueberry is apparent, but its tangy stewed apple is still more dominant.

Beer Names: Shiny Cocoa and Coconut Porter Barrel Aged
Reviews:
Bottle at Beer Dock, Crewe.  Barrel aged in bourbon barrels.

Nose is strongly cocoa, plus alcoholic strength.  Pours completely black with a very dark brown transient head.  In the mouth the alcohol is to the  fore, but there is also cocoa, chocolate and hints of chilli.  Finish is boozy with a warming glow !  One for sipping slowly methinks.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1593) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear dark brown to black beer, no head. Aroma: that's a lot of caramel in it, and a lot of coffee... also alcohol is very present, more roasted notes, somewhat nutty. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, bit malty, sourish, good roast, some coffee, dark chocolate. Aftertaste: bitter, malty, grains, bit sourish, caramel.

Beer Names: Glen Affric I Can't Believe It's Notella!
Reviews: Can, from Beer52. Black-brown, thin short lived pale beige head, and low condition. Big sweet nutty almond and chocolate ice cream initially in the nose, with some bitter coconut notes developing. Full and sweet in the mouth to start but quickly turns dry and bitter with some oily off notes. Finish is rough and bitter and a little nutty.
14 ounce snifter draft at The Hidden Pig, Haverhill, MA. Flavor shows me grapefruit, mild herbs, malt is mildly sweet. ABV  is lightly noticeable. A tad above average.

Cask @ The Pub, Todmorden.  Has this the week before finding the Maple edition and the Manchester Beer Festival and thought this version better in comparison.  Dark creamy-bubbly off-white head and a chocolate heavy nose, with a crisper lesser chocolate roasted taste.
12 ounce can from Ernie's in Lexington. An orange pour with floral nose and cinnamon in taste. Different.

Beer Names: Black Iris Rock Around The Clock
Reviews: Keg @ København, Halifax.  Golden in colour with a head.  Simply a pleasantly lightly carbonated fruity brew.

Bottle from Belgiuminabox.
Pours a hazy golden/amber colour with a huge white throthy head. Aromas of stoney fruits, apricots, peaches, tangerine, tropical fruits, apple pie, bread, jam, a little honey and sugar. Taste has the same but slightly milder notes than the aroma with added grass, spice, orange and lemon zest with a hoppy bitterness on the finish. Fair carbonation on the palate with a medium bodied mouthfeel and a fairly long zesty, hoppy and fruity aftertaste. Really nice

Beer Names: Cloudwater A Fire By the Bines
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml, shared with Simon, Max and Miro B. Hazy orange, white head. Hoppy, tropical fruit, mango, pineapple, juicy. Smooth. Medium bodied.
Cask @ Dockyard, Manchester.  Clear golden with a very thin head.  Has a soapy-hoppy texture and taste with a hint of sweetness.
Canned, 440 ml, shared with Max, Simon and Miro B. Hazy orange, medium white head. Dank, juicy, tropical fruit, sweetish, low bitterness. Juicy, medium bodied. Smooth.
No sweetness left, dry as fuck, but clean and crisp and well made with a great roast profile. Tilt birmingham

27/IX/19 - 75cl bottle @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1589) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Very cloudy bright orange beer, no head. Aroma: funky, very acidic, fruity, very tart impression, bit dirty, some cow fodder. MF: soft carbon, mediu mbody. Taste: bitter, fruity, dry, lots and lots of tannins, lemony, sourish. Aftertaste: dry, tannins, fruity, orange peel, not a big fan.

Beer Names: Track / St. Mars of the Desert Cydonia
Reviews: Can from Lupe Pintos. Hazy pale golden body with a white head. Lively carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of peach, lemon jelly and brioche. Flavour of lemongrass and lemon zest. Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Crisp and juicy. Fantastic.

Bottle from rhoihessegold in RB Euro Swap 2020-01 - Cheers!
Frothy light brown head left a thick creamy cover on a reddish brown still body.
Brown sugar, maple syrup & yeast, aroma.
Medium to full bodied, tingly on the front with smooth clean back.
Berries, syrup, jam, toffee, caramel & malt  tastes.
Banging!
# 1160; 7/2018. Slušný, leč nevýrazný Keller. Kvasnice dodávají sladové složce zajímavou ovocnou příchuť.

Sampled at Big Beers 2020 as "BART Aged in Bourbon Barrels". Brow/black appearance with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate malt, caramel, mild honey, light oak/bourbon and hints of dark fruit. Similar flavor, rich and layered with moderate sweetness, a medium to full body and a smooth warming finish.
Keg @ Pilcrow, Manchester.  Light golden with a small head.  It's dryish but crisp enough, otherwise a standard lager.
# 1159; 7/2018. Velmi kořenitý až bylinný, sladový, obilný, v dochuti mírně maltózová.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso propende per l'orzo. L'intensità olfattiva è normale, permanendo in maniera sufficiente. Il mantello birroso superiore resiste abbastanza. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di apparenza limpida. Il colore è giallo ambrato. Il corpo è rotondo. L'amaro è pronunciato. La forza gustativa è normale e si prolunga in modo sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di pronta beva. Il finale è semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. Il tetto della bocca riconosce impressioni di miele, crosta di pane, un accenno di resinoso quasi balsamico, erbaceo, agrumi, pompelmo rosa e arancia.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso resta attratto dal luppolo. L'intensità olfattiva è normale e la maniera in cui permane è sufficiente. Il mantello birroso superiore resiste poco. La grandezza delle bollicine è media. Il liquido è di consistenza limpida. Il colore è ambrato. Il corpo è pieno. L'amaro è deciso. La forza gustativa è elevata. La continuità gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano luppolate. Il finale è amarognolo. Il retrogusto è di decente intensità. In bocca l'aroma è quello di miele, crosta di pane, frutta secca, luppolo, resina, pino, agrumi, pompelmo, arancia amara e ananas.
# 1157; 7/2018. Lehoučké, svěží pšeničné pivo. Výrazně limetkový. Velmi dobré nízkoalkoholické osvěžení.

Cask at Brewery Tap, Chester

Pours a reddish shade of brown (not dark) with a small cream head.  Nose is just a vague hint of raspberries.  More happening in the mouth, sweet with dark fruits balanced by malts and a hint of chestnuts.  Finish is fruity.  Good but not a classic mild.

27/IX/19 - 75cl bottle @ Borefts Day 1, BB: V/2029, bottled: V/2019 - (2019-1585) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Pretty clear copper brown beer, no head. Aroma: nice lambic, malty, some caramel, dried fruits. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: nice acidity, little bitter, fruity touch, lovely. Aftertaste: dry, hoppy, fruity, nice acidity, good one!

Reddish amber appearance with a white head and pink hues. Aroma of sour funk, stone fruit and light oaky notes. Similar flavor, adding moderate acidity, light sweetness and a lingering tart/plum finish. Nice.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co / Square Root Grapefruit + Wormwood Sour
Reviews: Zesty and citrusy but clean and well made. But it is a lemon bomb to some extent. Tilt birmingham
# 1155; 7/2018. Výrazně ovocný weizenbock s chutí tropickýho ovoce a žlutých melounů a rybízu v dochuti.

Ever so slightly hazy copper and lightly bronzed coloured body with a bright orange tint and a smallish, two centimetre tall off-white head. Aroma of citrus, light white grape juice, a dash of flowers and some pungent resin in the mix that all shows a nice level of alpha acid from the hops and a light dose of oranges and bitterness as well. Light to Medium-bodied; Strong rich grassy flavours up front, but the citrus, grapefruit, resin and supportive malt all really come through and provide a very nice balance, along with a good deal of alcohol noticeable, especially at the end, without much fruits or sugars. Aftertaste shows the hops and attached bitterness quite strongly with a lot of citrus and grapefruit  notes and some floral flavours towards the end that hit the hoppy and bitter notes nicely. Overall, a pungent and strongly hopped beer that has a great level of alpha acids and hops to make this feel almost that of a West Coast IPA, but made here on the East Coast! I sampled this sixteen ounce, pint-sized can, given to me by the GM of the brewery, after a hockey game here in Arlington (Ballston), Virginia in May 2019 - Thanks Erik!
# 1153; 7/2018. Hodně drsně chmelené pšeničné pivo, silné bylinné tóny, citrusová kůra, banány. Osobité, ale velmi dobré.

Keg at the Euston tap. A hazed translucent golden coloured pour with a fine white head. Aroma is subdued, fishy, stake whwat, grass.. Flavour is composed of range banana loaf, doughy wheat tangy apple, frorhy carbonation. Palate is light tangy, froth carbonation, banana bread mineral. Ok.
High tart and sour, but clean with a great world class profile. Light and refreshing but a fantastic sipping beer. Tilt birmingham
# 1152; 7/2018. Chuťove velmi bohaté pivo. Silně pražené s lehce nakyslým ocáskem, který mi připomněl darjeelingy. Kávové, sušené ovoce. Parádní dlouhé doznívání.

HAHA, funny name and interesting can from chalet.  Once popped, this stuff smells like a pine tree, no lie, a real Christmas tree, heheh. Taste is spruce and pine needles. Yes, it really does make me think that it's Christmas. Color is slightly darker than pale. Lots of hops and very few if any spices, as in any other holiday brew that is spiced to death and I'm glad, I dislike those holiday spiced brews. Yes, more like an IPA and I bet IPA lovers will like this. Can't really find the orange peel, but I think I do pick up a little bit of ginger and heat in the finish. I don't like IPA but this is better than most holiday brews. So be it.
# 1151; 7/2018. Velmi dobré, vícevrstevnaté, tmavé pšeničné. Ovocné, kolové, topinkové. Bohužel i s trochu lakovitým ocáskem.

2016 Edition: Dark fruit, woody oaky, lactic sour aroma and flavors. Deep plum date and raisin aroma and flavor with tannic oaky and a Cabernet like red wine finish.  Sour maybe 5 or 6 of 10. All lactic/acetic.  Complex dark red wine flavors with the dark fruits are great.  Really delicious and complex.
Not the best taste in the world, but I am not able to say so many bad things from a beer which costs 30 cents... Not a bad taste.

Mildly syrupy, but not overly sweet. Woody and raisiny, if that’s a real word. Not your “traditional beer” taste. Sold by the ounce at Boxelder in Miami. Very interesting to try, worth trying, but personally wouldn’t try it again, not my style.

4 finger creamy beige head. Fantastic spider-web lacing.
Pitch black beer.

Aroma of vanilla, cocoa, hazelnut coffee, milk chocolate and a light brown round woodiness. Slight note of emptied oak barrel. Simple but effective.

Taste is similar at first but throws in a lot of acidic vinous notes along with a bigger gourmand presence and a clear boozy note. Not necessarily bourbon but a general spirit booziness.

Mouthfeel is somewhat dense and chewy but with a lighter landing that I don't fully appreciate. Sticky. Medium bitterness. Medium-low carbonation. Semi-long finish. 

Overall: Expected way more to be honest. Maybe it needs to warm up more to show its true potential. Been resting in the cabinet for quite a while too but it feels unbalanced and a bit all over the place.
44cl can. A murky yellow golden beer with a white foamy head. Aroma of mellow fruits, mild citra, yeast, wheat. Taste is mealy juicy mild hoppy, wheat malt, citra, yeasty finish.

This one was surprising to me.  It's essentially the perfect sessionable Belgian styled amber ale. Awesome spicy Belgian yeast backed by strong caramel malt is the main flavor and aroma component. A nip of raisin and cotton candy. Lightly sweet, very malty, but well in balance. This would pair with any pub grub. Nice substantial chewy mouthfeel that lightens as it fades. A modern masterpiece from the only Trappist brewery in North America. Impressive.

Beer Names: Cloudwater When The Wind Blows, Let It Blow
Reviews: 440ml can brewed in England at 5.1%. Ruddy light-brown amber, with a large, stable head. Relatively clear. Very 'amber ale' aroma, as might be expected! Hints of red berry and a light but slightly dark maltiness, extremely mild woody elements. Low carbonation. Gentle mineral-water aspects, some red/dark berry elements, pretty laid-back in general. Light, sweet amber ale. Faint hints of a toasted bread malt. The delicacy actually makes this come off as pretty high-quality. Don't expect an all-singing all-dancing brew and this little gem will give you a luxurious, genteel drinking experience. Understated and, I think, underrated.

Birra rovinata dalla GDO quasi sicuramente,una IPA bilanciata ma con un corpo scarno.Schiuma abbondante ma non permanente.L’importa industriale è evidente nell’analisi visiva.Tutto sommato da “compagnia”
Heavy orange zest and tangerine, dank, cloudy yellow, bitter, juicy, very zesty, tropical, bit grassy, light, very drinkable, amazing light pale!
Canned from penn.  Didn't see the pour. Hints of grapefruit and cereal. Very fine.

16 ounce can

A pleasing imperial stout delivers a polished experience without going overboard. It is hard to see much here that isn't available in a typical example of the style. Even so thanks to Drake for sharing this during a winter tasting.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Smoky coffee, espresso, and sticky hazy malts crawl over the nose in search of places to leave a mark. The fluid black base supports a lean mocha head.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Smoky plum, dark fruit, and chocolate empower the rich profile that warms the throat. It then ebbs into a malty dense texture that sticks in the palate. There are few objections though nothing that stands out as an amazing release that sets itself apart in a busy crowd.
Really nice clean rock solid full bodied complex yet light and honey-like. Old joint stock and pub birmingham
A slightly bitter astringent taste, but a good body and nice malt profile. Old joint and stock birmingham

375 ml bottle

An excellent gem from the East Coast shows that Allagash is still on top of their game when it comes to balancing tartness with depth. It might not be my favorite release yet just thinking about it makes me wish that I had a glass to sip right now.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Vinegary plums, raspberry, and a sharp abrasive profile gnaw at the nose. The vanilla head rests over a bed of caramel as the lean base swirls freely around the glass.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Cherry and Sour Patch Kids imbued with raspberry cling to the senses as the vinegar works it way into every corner of the throat. A rich finish of freshly picked strawberries polish off an excellent experience. I would happily drink this again if I came across a tap line.

Keg at the brewdog tower hill. A murky yellow golden coloured pour with halo of white head. Aroma is weird, sweaty nettle, grassy, some cress, wheaty grains. Flavour is composed of semi sweet, orange rind z sticky fruit Smoothie dank hop, grass, grassy tropical. Juicy,. Palate is medium sweet, grainy, moderate carbonation. Sticky hop. Ok
Tastes a little oxidized from the old joint and stock pub in Birmingham. Otherwise, it’s a completely awesome chewy full bodied beer that is so elegent

750 ml bottle

Well past its prime, this release shows what happens when you sit on a bottle too long. I can only imagine what it must have been like in its prime to still be this solid. If it weren't for the packed shelves I would love to try a few more Love Child releases.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
A rich ivory head dances upwards as the caramel body chews at the foundation. A strong sour intensity has taken root as the brett is center stage. Behind it the musty profile indicates other aspects have mellowed with time.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Acidic astringent chocolate tickles the tongue. Clearly past its prime, this Flemish sour hits the palate with a harsh bite. Even the finish, tart Tootsie Roll, shows signs of having been more polished in the past. It will be nice to get more of these out of the cellar to make room for fresher offerings.

W aromacie kawa, czerwone owoce i szlachetne kwaśne nuty, szlachetny alkohol, super. Barwa czarna, piana ładna. W smaku pełne, półsłodkie, czekolada, kawa, kwaśna wiśnia, dobry, mocny trunek. Na finiszu nieco pestkowe. Bardzo fajny ris i bardzo szlachetna kwaśność, super.
355ml bottle.  Pours very dark brown with a medium head.  Aroma is beefy bitter roast coffee.  Taste has cola, roast and chocolate.  Beefy finish.

Dieses bittet habe ich schon vor einigen Jahren getrunken und ich will mit ihm abschließen.
Es ist ein schwerer Belgier, der aber durch seine Hopfennoten überrascht und erfreut. Es hat im Hintergrund eine fruchtige Rumtopf-Atmosphäre, aber mit Hopfenspitzen vom Nugget-Hopfen, die wahrlich erfreuen.
Kein klassisches belgisches Strong Ale, aber ein durchaus aromatisches Bier.

33cl swing top bottle bought at the brewpub. A clear deepest amber beer with a mid sized good lasting off-white head. Aroma of resinous hops, spruce, caramel, red malt. Taste of strong caramelized malt, red malt, spruce, pine needles, strong hoppy and malty finish.

On tap in Madison, WI

The packaging drew me in but despite having a bottle in the cellar I finally caved and ordered a draft at a local bar. I'm happy though as the results are subpar for a Central Waters imperial stout. This is less imperial and more mundane. Save your money for their other more polished releases.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
A delicate mocha head rests above the fluid black base. Moving freely around the shaker it releases droves of smoky ash, espresso, and cocoa in a profile that feels a bit tame for the style. 

FLAVOR / PALATE
Smoky espresso, malt, and cocoa enrich the palate with a fluid refreshing feel that dances rather than crawls over the tongue. Given the description I was anticipating a bit more. I'll still crack open the bottle to see if I get better results but overall this feels like a half hearted effort from Amherst.

Unfiltered lightly hazy yellow pour. Large tight bubbled head. Moderate lacing. Pale malt, light breadiness, and some grassy hops in the aroma. Very clean with a moderately bitter hop fade. Crisp and poundable. A very good German pils.

355ml can. Murky, darkest brown colour with average to huge, thick, frothy to creamy, slowly osteoporosing, moderately lacing, dark beige to tan head. Citrusy hoppy and roasty, chocolately, dark malty aroma, notes of cocoa, chocolate, coffee, hints of lemon, orange, mandarine with a zesty touch, some grass and chlorophyll as well. Taste is dry, grassy and zesty, citrusy hoppy, roasty and chocolately dark malty, notes of orange, lemon, mandarine, lemon zest, hints of cocoa, coffee. Not fully harmonious, malty and hoppy flavours remain slightly separated due to the high-grade dryness; some more sweetness could build a bridge. Not bad, though.

On tap in Madison, WI

A potent imperial stout proves that it can stand up to any other challenger with a robust rich profile that was well worth the trip to Barley Pop by itself. I'd love to try some of the variants now that I have a baseline to see if they can improve on an already world class release.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Chocolate, coffee, and oily malts stick in the air with a heavy fog. Beneath come waves of espresso, dark fruits, and strong alcohol that warms the air. A rich oily base blends both melted chocolate and mocha into a dense presence.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Epresso, heavy coffee, chocolate, plum, and an oily essence blend into a deceptively smooth body. The chewy mouthfeel clings to the corners of the palate as layers of warmth build on the palate. The results speak for themselves as this world class imperial stout delivers a product worth traveling or trading for.

Beer Names: Northern Monk Patrons Project 21.01 Dream Line Forms: One
Reviews:
Draught @ Rowdy Hops Beer Festival - [ Session 2 ] @ Ridehuset, Vester Alle 1, 8000 Aarhus, Danmark.[ As Northern Monk Patrons Project 21.01 // SKGN // Dream Line Forms: One // DDH IPA ].ABV: 7.4%. Murky matt medium yellow orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, sweet malt, wheat, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, rich fruit, tropical fruit - lychee - orange. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long duration, rich fruit, wheat, pale malt, fruity malt, tropical fruit, piney, citrus, light spicy hops - peppery hops. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20191101]
 7-3-7-4-15

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1578) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear red brown beer, no head. Aroma: very malty, grains, hay, cow fodder, barn yard. MF: lively carbon, medium body. Taste: very malty start, caramel, some chocolate notes, soft acidity, lots of alcohol. Aftertaste: more alcohol, bitter touch, fruit notes, nice one!

Aroma: Earthy and citrusy with some malty notes. Not very intensive.

Appearance: Clear yellow. Poor white head.

Taste: Bitter, slightly sweet.

Palate: Medium body, average carbonation.

Overall: Decent, well-executed English IPA.

AR: Röstmalz, Kaffee, Holz, angebrannt
AP: trübes schwarz
TA: Röstmalz, Malzbier, Kaffee, Holz, angebrannt

0,33 l Flasche, mit Bock- Anhänger. Dunkelbraunes Bier, stabiler, hellbrauner Schaum, tolle Gardine. Riecht intensiv malzig, Karamell, leichte Röstaromen, Kaffee. Der Geschenk bestätigt den Geruch, weiterhin sehr intensiv. Sehr voll im Geschmack, leicht ölig, prickelt auf der Zunge.

On tap at brewpub

This would not have been my first choice but as it was a special release for Vintage's anniversary I rolled the dice. Unfortunately it did not deliver. In hindsight I would have happily gone for one of their other special releases rather than a rum infused sour that lacks a core identity.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
The deep reddish base and lean white head rest easily in the glass. Medicinal anise, dark fruit, and cranberry force their way into focus before slowly melting away into a mellow memory.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Cranberries, flat Dr Pepper, and shots of rum do little to generate enthusiasm once the novelty wears off. A spicy transition rushes into the tart finish with little thought for balance or continuity. First rum, then winter warmer, then anise sour, it cannot decide what facet should be its defining characteristic. As a result it is hard to recommend this unless you really need to rate everything on the menu.

27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1577) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear dark brown beer, creamy beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: oh my, lots of tonka bean, vanilla, chocolate, cinnamon, caramel, chocolate, lovely stuff! MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: lots of chocolate up front, spicy, tonka beans, some chilli, alcohol, caramel, more chocolate, nice one, really lovely! Aftertaste: cinnamon, tonka beans, spicy, alcohol, vanilla, good roast, lovely beer!
Tastes like a wheat beer with blueberries. It's a solid beer. It reminds me of the blueberry beer at Bricktown Brewery.
A really beautiful mild amber ale with restrained bitterness. Old joint and stock birmingham

On tap at brewpub

With kviek popping up more often I took the opportunity of ordering this barleywine as soon as I saw it on the menu. In this case it creates a unique experience ideal for a winter warmer. Give it some consideration if you are at the brewpub.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Cool earthy tomato and malt ground the textures of caramel and noble hops. Even the cool coppery base and lean ivory head help tether this with a warm inviting presence.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Creamy oak, vanilla, and earthy almonds transition to a profile of dry sherry. The soothing warm finish glows on the back of the throat. The hops accent a well balanced experience that might be the best draft at Vintage right now.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co / De Molen XXXK Mild
Reviews:
27/IX/19 - on cask @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1575) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Clear amber beer, big solid beige creamy head, stable, adhesive, leaving some lacing in the glass. Aroma: sweet, caramel, very malty, grains, hay, sweetish, dried fruits. MF: soft to no carbon, medium to light body. Taste: malty, caramel, bitter hops, bit of dried fruits, soft roast. Aftertaste: bitter and dry, hoppy finish.

Keg at Brewdog Tower Hill. A hazed golden orange coloured pour with a frothy white head. Aroma is sweet juicy orange, sticky tropical, grape. Woody mango. Light tang. Flavour is composed of tangy fruit Smoothie, tart citrus, green mango, lassi, lactose sugars, pithy finish. Palate is semi sweet, tangy, moderate carbonation. Fun.
Rich but light and very dessert-like. Not a big beer. Drinkable though, very. Old joint & stock birmingham

Beer Names: North Brewing Co Northern Bloc Sorbet Sour
Reviews:
27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1574) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Very cloudy pale pink beer, no head. Aroma: all raspberries, hint of yoghurt, fruity touch, bit spicy. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: all raspberries, fruity, nice acidity. Aftertaste: raspberries, very fruity, bit metallic, lovely stuff going on here, little metallic, lemony finish.
Piuttosto chiara con schiuma molto densa e persistente. Lunga persistenza con finale amaro costante e retrogusto di limone. Note erbacee e resinose tipiche della ipa. Effervescenza equilibrata.

On tap at brewpub

This particular style has piqued my curiosity for a while. Either I'm suddenly seeing these everywhere or more breweries are trying to set themselves apart with something unique. Regardless this is well worth sampling at the source as part of a flight.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
A coppery reddish base glints under a dirty vanilla head. Spicy rye and Twizzlers sharpen into focus alongside a malty core. Almost immediately it is obvious that this is not your average rye beer.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Sharp caramel dipped in rye whiskey pushes to the front of the throat with an urgency. A strong presence continues to coat the tongue sip after sip until the final burst of spicy rye radiates in the throat. If this demonstrates the style at all I will be happy to try a few more down the road.
tipica WC Ipa. Color dorado, poca espuma, aroma pino, en boca melon y pino son los sabores dominantes, final amargo largo

Bag-in-Box på GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Lyserosa. 0 skum. Nesten klar. Aroma av epleskall. Smaken parfymert. Kirsebær & epler. Litt mandler. Mye mandler i ettersmaken. Ikke ueffen som dessert.
33c bottle. A hazy yellow golden beer with a white head. Aroma is fresh juicy hoppy, grassy, lot of fresh citrus fruits. Taste is juicy and slight bitter hoppy, grassy, a bit yeasty. Easy to drink.

Bottle at home. This version's is 3.3%. It pours hazy bright yellowy gold with a thick, fluffy white head. The aroma is fresh and bright, ripe orangey fruits, apricot, peach, zingy tangerine, orange chewits and some sponge cake. The taste is crisp, dry, decent hit of bitterness, cleaned and bright, lovely orangey fruit character, tangerine, apricot, peach, touch of straw and grass with a quenching lay dry finish. Light+ body and decent, yet fine carbonation. Flavourful and effortlessly drinkable. God damn quenching and moreish.

On tap at brewpub

A typical New England style IPA, this polished example of the style stands out as a drinkable and accessible version that can help further understand the thought behind it. I can't say that I will be sad when hazy IPAs are in the rear view mirror but until then if most are at this level then I can enjoy the ride.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Yeast, mango, and tropical fruit salad sticks in the air with a dense texture similar to sweet fog. If you look up the definition of the style this would be very close to ideal. The citrusy body clouds the glass like unfilitered pureed lemons decorated by a layer of white frosting.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Creamy vanilla yogurt infused with mango and oranges radiates on the tongue. The cool transition ebbs into a thick smoothie profile and eventually a vibrant bitterness. From start to finish it provides a hook that shines the stage light on a polished release. Drafts like this show that Vintage is not resting on their laurels.
Mild röstiger, süß schokoladiger Beginn. Ansteigende Herbe von geringem Level aus, rund malzig, hohe Süffigkeit. Süßlich schokoladiger Nachhall. Okay. 10/9/8/8/9/8
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Kortlivd filmskum. Anonym maltaroma. Smaken gress. Mais i en lett tørr avslutning.

On tap at brewpub

A local sour fuses Wisconsin cranberries with a tangy essence to create a middle of the road kettle sour. If you enjoy your cranberry juice more abrasive than normal then source this or something like it.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Dried cranberries and tart cherry pits tickle the senses. A mild fruity undercurrent is crisp and tart though not intensely abrasive like something from Funk Factory. Even the semitransparent reddish core resembles a cranberry influenced mocktail.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Tart cranberry lined with salty Sour Patch Kid sugar scour the tongue clean. The texture becomes more abrasive over time as it lingers in the throat. Compared to others it might be somewhat pedestrian but it does enough to be a worthwhile experience.

Double-mashed NEIPA hopped with Citra and Mosaic, at Nieuwjaarsreceptie Gentse Biervereniging.  Egg-white, mousy, open, rather thin and irregular head, cloudy to even 'milky' apricot-hued 'yolk yellow' blonde.  Aroma of mango juice, moldy oranges, diesel, damp marijuana, dough, overripe Zespri kiwi.  Sweet onset with a sourish edge, lots mango juice, granadilla and starfruit 'tropicality', very juicy with medium fizz, doughy, soft malt body with honeyish sweetness continuing, until a very dank and very sultry hoppiness takes over, quite citric and refreshing but with again lots of ripe mango and papaja as well; some warming alcohol and a light 'green' hop bitterness are noticeable in the finish.  Does its job as a present-day hazy IPA.

04-02-2020; bottle; at home (bought at de Bodega, Capelle Aan den IJssel, The Netherlands).
04-02-2020; bottle; at home (bought at de Bodega, Capelle Aan den IJssel, The Netherlands).
The looks of the beer are nice. It is a decent looking Belgian Blond. The colour is a nice golden yellow, with a pleasant amber touch. It glows golden. It has a slight haziness. On top of the beer a nice smooth layer of white foam is formed. Foam retention is average. A nice drape is left on top of the beer. It looks very pleasant. 
The aroma of the beer is very nice. It is a typical Belgian Ale. The malts are nice and a bit caramel and also fruity. Touch of bread is there too. Very pleasant. The hops are floral and a bit herbal. The floral bouquet goes well with the malt notes. The herbal notes go well with the yeast aromas. These are spicy and also fruity, with some typical notes of banana. Very pleasant. 
The taste of the beer also is very nice. It is perfectly balanced. The malts are sweet and the creamy yeast gives an extra nice smooth touch to this. The hops are nice and bitter. The bitters and sweets are in perfect harmony. Really good. The palate of the beer is nice too. Medium body, smooth texture and very nice high carbonation. The finish of the beer is nice and is filled with smooth and subtle floral and herbal hop notes and some of that spicy yeast. All in all, a very nice beer. Absolutely more towards the top of the specter than the bottom. I like it.

Beer Names: Northern Monk / By The River Northern Powerhouse Brew Series 2019 007
Reviews: 440ml can brewed in England at 10%. Ultra dark brown, nearly black in the glass. Small, shortish-lasting head, only somewhat off-white. Maple and chocolate syrup aroma. Next to no carbonation. Medium thickness, part of what makes it an Imperial Brown and not a Stout. Initial hop hit (Northern Monk is usually good with this; I wish they'd listed the hops used!) adds a punch and some bitterness (mild, mind) to balance the ensuing sweetness of developing chocolate syrup with a caramel tint and maple syrup that are the main thrusts of this beer. Absolutely delish. In the finish, brown and toasty malts make themselves known alongside a cocoa powder/coffee powder element, rounding things off with a mocha tint. Delightful. Can it beat the legendary Founders' similar offerings? No, but it sure stands alongside them. Superb tipple, for me the star in the 2019 Northern Powerhouse firmament. As a Maple Imperial Brown, it could be called a bit generic - but is that really a negative? I'd say that means this is the one by which the rest of the brews in the style get to define themselves. Good luck tracking one of these down - frankly, it'd be a crying shame if this were merely a one-off. Northern Monk, By The River - give us another one, do!

Bouteille 35,5cl
Mousse : Fines couche et collerettes blanches
Couleur : Robe orangée  à ambrée
Nez : Malt épicé, houblon herbeux, douceur fruitée tropical
Bouche : Attaque douce, bouquet malt et houblon, herbe, biscuit. Seconde bouche miel, épices, houblon herbeux, fruité, caramel épicé et touche résineux / amer et citron. Finition complexe : malt doux bonbon au miel à caramel, épicé, fruité, résineux et en toute fin retour sur l’amertume herbeuse très persistante en longueur.
Avis : Superbe complexité et originalité, saveurs riches et puissantes,  pour titrage modeste, qui va bien au-delà d’une simple Pale Ale.
