440ml can from We Brought Beer, Balham.  Clear deep golden.  Aroma is piney and with a certain crispness.  It’s quite malty and quite crisp.  Kind of ticks all the boxes of west coast, but without really ticking them.  This means that it is actually more quintessential than you think. ￼

Obtained at States Street Liquor from Redlands, California for $23.99, Pawpaw is a golden sour ale aged on whole pawpaws brewed by Upland Brewing Company from Bloomington, Indiana. 

The air reveals pawpaws, mango, and peach upon the nose. The appearance is a cloudy yellow that pours a fast dissipating white head. The alcohol content is 7.3%.

Pawpaw provides a creamy banana like feel that follows with a light custard touch. Lemon tarts the take and tones the drink. Mango smooths the mouthfeel and assists with the sweet complexion. Peaches are juicy to the body and deepens the juicy comprehension. A hay-like funk is sensible with the lemon and pawpaw blend along with a soft lactic tinge. Oak offers a woodsy hue to the lemony and creamy pawpaw frame.

Pawpaw is a mesmerizing golden sour ale. Pawpaw, lemon, mango, and peach combination colors the fair sour sensation. The pawpaw comes across like guava except with a custard pinch at the end. The lactic feel is barely noticeable until the beer begins to warm. The sour and tart is easy to experience along with the watery aspect of this libation. I loved each drink and impressed by the pawpaw, lemon, and mango composition.

Cheers. Prost. Drink for the love of beer.

For more beer reviews, visit and like my blog “Drink For the Love of Beer.”

On tap at Bath Brewhouse. Pours opaque orange golden with a white head. Aroma: lactose, stone fruits, citrus. Taste: moderate to heavy sweet, nae bitterness. Lactose & peach. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carb. Creamy sweet finish. Shite

Can in a trade with tfontana, thanks Tom. 11-20-19 canning. Pushing the limits on hop freshness on this one! But it all works out in the end! Aroma: bold tropical fruit, soft malt. Flavor has strong tropical fruit, mild grassy, and a light malt backbone. Clearly the best beer I ever had from this brewery. Glad they finally stepped up their game!

Bottle from TERMINAL DE CRUCEROS, Puerto Barrios Guatemala.
Clear light yellow with a white head.
Grassy corn aroma.
Not much here flavor-wise.

[33cl can from M&S, Bracknell.] A hazy pale straw coloured pour with a fast fading, soapy looking white head; berry fruit aroma; fruity, biscuity body; with a sharp fruity bitterness and a vegetal finish. Odd.

Beer Names: Tooth & Claw / S43 Chocolate Orange Stout
Reviews: 4/2/2020. Growler sample courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed! Great looking pour, almost black with a nice size light tan coloured head. Aroma of dark chocolate, chocolate orange, light roasted malt, caramel, coffee, dried fruit and a touch of liquorice. Medium sweetness and light to moderate bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Very nice.

500ml bottle from local Tesco. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma: malt dominates with hoppy hints. Taste: light to moderate sweet & moderate bitter with the roasted malts overpowering the hops. Hints of dary berry fruits and pine. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Dry bitter finish. It's OK but the hops need to shine more and roasted malts to be less dominant for it to be a decent BIPA, for me

473ml can. Hazy, bright, orangey golden colour with average, frothy, osteoporosing, moderately lacing, white head. Slightly cautious, juicy, tropical fruity, hoppy aroma, hints of tropical fruit, mango, passion fruit, oaty malty background; resinous and piney notes become laid bare belatedly, a touch of peanut alike, embedded in a mild orange and mandarine cushion. Taste is sweet-ish, wheaty and slightly dry, oaty malty, minimally sugary, unspecific and not overly intense, fruity hoppy, some tropical fruit, some mandarine and orange; again, the initially disguised resinous and piney hoppy core becomes laid bare delayed, only accompanied by diffident mandarine and orange flavours. Minimally mushy texture, smooth and soft palate. Overall too well-behaved, reserved, withdrawn concerning fruity hoppy aspects; with all them fruity flavours evaporated remains a very harmonious and balanced, biscuity pale malty and resinous hoppy DIPA. Somehow like an mediocre Imperial NEIPA in Kernel clothing. So what has to be rated here? I'm indecisive. For now an unmotivated compromise.

330ml Can from Asda, Enniskillen (£1.50):
Light & clear amber a thin, bubbly white lacing that fades fast & leaves a clean, slightly skunky nose with some pale malts, faint grassy notes & a touch of lemon. The taste is bitter & skunky with faint grassy hops & hay coming through alongside bread malts but not much else. The body is light, clean & lightly carbonated but quite sharp at the end too.

On tap at Nepenthe Brewing Co. in Baltimore, MD. 

Murky, tawny gold with an off-white head and excellent lacing.  

Aroma of tropical fruit, oatmeal, honey and fruit I can’t identify. 

Taste of pineapple, tropical fruit, rye bread and kumquat. 

Medium body and medium carbonation.

4/2/2020. Bottle sample courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed! Pours hazy dark amber with a bubbly/frothy off-white head. Aroma of light whiskey, wood, citrus, berries, apple, funky notes and a hint of marzipan. Moderate sweetness and medium tartness. Medium body, oily texture, a bit above average carbonation. Enjoyable.

Pours a clear, golden amber coloration with a small, creamy, stable head. Smells of sweet, doughy malt, coffee cream and vanilla, with just a hint of actual coffee. Taste is very much dominated by sweet, doughy malt, coffee cream and vanilla, with some hazelnut also coming through, as well as just a hint of coffee and white chocolate. Finishes almost sickly sweet, with some coffee cream and vanilla lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation.

While this does an ok job at imitating a White Russian, it's just way too syrupy sweet and creamy/milky for an enjoyable Imperial Stout, with the vanilla being way overdone and very little coffee coming through. While the mouthfeel is all right, I expected more from a nitro can. Nobody loves the Big Lebowski more than me, but this does not tie it together very well at all, no need to be careful about this beverage. But well, you know, that's just like, my opinion man.

440ml Can from Asda, Enniskillen (£1.50):
Bright amber & hazy with a thin head that's frothy white. The nose is sharp with plenty citrus & dry hops, orange & grapefruit. It's not as strong as expected for the strength but the taste is slightly more pronounced with lots of citrus & orange, grapefruit & bitter pine hops. The alcohol content is masked well & it's fairly easy to drink too, with moderate carbonation & a slightly warming finish.

Beer Names: Saucony Creek Unicorns on a Road Trip
Reviews:
16 oz can from Joe Canal's, 2/4/20.  Canned 12/5/19.  Pours a murky yellowish color, decent off-white head, moderate lace.  Aroma is lemon-lime, grass, pale malts, and a little dough.  Some light citrus notes as well.  Flavor is thin overall, with lemon and pale malts coming through with a mild sweetness and a mild bitterness.  None of the juicy brightness or hop bitterness for that matter that you'd expect from the listed hops, just kind of a thin, watery hoppy blonde ale thing going.  Lively mouthfeel, somewhat dry close.  Feels like either they missed the mark or this is one of those IPAs where if it's more than a month old all the flavor is gone.  Either way, it's mediocre.  
6/3/5/3/11

330ml Can from Asda, Enniskillen (£1.50):
Light, bright amber with a clear body & white, foamy head that holds well. The nose is hoppy with pine & faint citrus but it's definitely subdued. The taste is similarly subdued & slightly off with bitter hop oils, citrus & faint grapefruit. Its a light bodied beer with a smooth, sharp feel but its too light for the most part & a little disappointing.
Can from Emsworth Brewhouse. Cloudy copper colour with medium head, strong citrus aroma, piney hop with a hint of minerals. Nice.

On tap at Nepenthe Brewing Co. in Baltimore, MD. 

Hazy, light yellow with and off-white head and very good lacing.  

Aroma of tangerine, wheat, papaya, mango and other citrus. 

Taste of citrus, tropical fruit and wheat. 

Medium/full body and medium/high carbonation with a foamy mouthfeel.

650ml bottle shared with brother at my place. Thanks for the share Guillaume. Aroma: lots of bourbon, rye too (I know there is no rye), light Cuban cigar, shy roasted malt, lots of chocolate. App: black, thick texture, minimal to no brown head, thick brown lacing. Taste and palate: full body, thick, medium sweetness, roasted bitter finish. Overall: love the nose of this beer. It reminds me of the nose of most of the Alesmith Speedway variants (BASS, BAVSS). The palate is rather sweet but still really easy to drink even if shared with only one person. Great.

330ml Can from Asda, Enniskillen (£1.50):
Caramel amber & a tiny, hazy head that's frothy white head but very thin. It's a sharp, hoppy nose with pine hops & light citrus, herbal touches & floral notes too with some caramel to finish. It's a perfume taste with floral flavours, grassy hops &  pine before sweet malts see things out. The body is medium & dry with a subtle tang at the end; it's an interesting beer but nothing special.

Can, from Beer52. Jet black, fluffy and sustaining beige head and gentle condition. Big roasted barley, liquorice, coffee and a slightly sharp fruity berry note in the nose, quite full in the mouth with a slight creamy sweetness, some blackcurrant fruitiness that becomes slightly tart, hints of bitter coffee and some liquorice notes. Finish has a dry roasted barley bitterness, some sweetness, and a slightly fruity liquorice note lingering.

Pours very dark ruby brown with big foamy head. Aroma is surprisingly close to weissbier with banana and cloves, burnt sugar, wood, dark dried berries. Flavor is sweet and mellow, full body but not too heavy with pleasant texture, hidden but a bit noticeable alcohol, malty and a bit fruity (dark overripe fruits).
Jasnozłociste, klarowne piwo. Piana słaba. Aromat nikły, delikatna nuta kwiatów. W smaku wodniste, cienkie i bez wyrazu. Mocno nasycone, zapychające, goryczki brak.

On tap at Nepenthe Brewing Co. in Baltimore, MD. 

Clear, golden yellow with an off-white head and excellent lacing.  

Aroma of citrus and wet laundry. 

Taste of citrus, pale malt and sweaty socks. 

Medium body and medium/low carbonation.  

This one did not work for me.

Beer Names: Cloudwater / After The Harvest / Oliver's La Deuxième Saison Des Poires
Reviews: 4/2/2020. Bottle sample courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed! Pours hazy pale yellow gold with a short lasting white head. Aroma of citrus, tart perry, dandelion, rubber, gooseberry, lemon puff biscuit and a hint of pineapple. Moderate sweetness and light bitterness/tartness. Moderate body, oily texture, average carbonation. Light tart dry finish. Worked quite nicely.

On tap at Pig & Fiddle, Bath. pours clear mid yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma: pale & sweet malts, grassy hints, light floral. Taste: light to moderate sweet & light bitter, grainy, pinch of lime. Light body, ample carbonation, sweet-ish finish

On tap at Nepenthe Brewing Co. in Baltimore, MD. 

Very hazy, amber gold with an off-white head and excellent lacing.  

Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit and pineapple. 

Taste of mandarin orange, tropical fruit, grapefruit, pineapple and pine. 

Medium/full body and medium/low carbonation. with a luscious mouthfeel.

473ml can drank at home with brother. Thanks for the share. Aroma: lots of onions, burst of fruits, piney. App: milky orange, small to medium white head, great lacing. Taste and palate: full body, yeasty and juicy, fruity a lot, good bitterness finish. Overall: excellent. Love the good balance between the juiciness and bitterness. Really well done. Excellent.

Beer Names: Evil Twin NYC Ever Since I Moved To New York City My Wardrobe Has Shifted To Mostly Black Or Dark Colors
Reviews: Can [email protected], Copenhagen (25/01/2020) - very hazy to opaque orange coloured pour with a white head. Intense big juicy fruity with waves of papaya, mango, grapefruit, pineapple, sweet soft malts, soft pillowy mouthfeel and medium body, bold punchy hoppy finish. Gorgeous!

Very lemony, lots of citrus notes. Enough funk to let you know that this is a real mixed ferm and not another kettle sour, but a lot of lacto notes and it lacks the complexity of some mixed fermentation beers. This is what I'd give to a kettle sour fan who hadn't gotten into real sours yet. Not terrible, but I'm probably not buying it again.

On tap at Nepenthe Brewing Co. in Baltimore, MD. 

Very hazy, leather-yellow with an off-white head and excellent lacing.  

Aroma of orange, lactose, sweet pink grapefruit and pineapple. 

Taste of grapefruit juice, tangerine, pineapple and lactose. 

Medium body and medium carbonation with a soft mouthfeel.

Beer Names: Evil Twin NYC / American Solera Brewers Without Borders
Reviews: Can [email protected], Copenhagen (25/01/2020) -  black with a thin tan head. Dark sweet and roasted malty witn note aof chocolate, caramel, nice coffee roast, bold nutty accents, full body, hazelnut and sweet vanilla coalesce into the dark sweet and roasted malty finish. Lovely stuff.
Dark brown  color pour with an off-white head and light lacing. Malty aroma with nuts and molases in the flavor profile. It has a slightly dry finish.

Beer Names: Evil Twin NYC / Horus Aged Ales Even More Territory
Reviews: Can [email protected], Copenhagen (25/01/2020) - black with a tan covering. Roasted and light sweet dark malty with notes of chocolate, bold coffee roast, burnt brown sugar, full body, nutty chocolate and coffee laden malty finish.

Bottle from rhoihessegold - RB Euro 2020-01 swap - Cheers!
Rocky white head left a froth on a hazy amber coloured still body.
Big juicy aroma of Tropical fruits, pineapple & confectionery.
Medium bodied, slight tingle on the front with a soft cloying back.
Peach, mango, pineapple, Tropical fruits & hoppy tastes with a long tangy finish.
Good one!

Beer Names: Evil Twin NYC Sour Pepper Cherry
Reviews: Can [email protected], Copenhagen (25/01/2020) - dark amber with a off white head. Prominent Dr Pepper with notes of cherry, fruity and light spiced, cola notes, medium body, sweet syrupy notes, cherry accented into the finish. Does what it says on the tin! Fun stuff.

4/2/2020. Cask sample courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed! Pours clear dark golden amber with a bubbly white head. Aroma of fruit, malt, hops, biscuit and slight stewed veg. Moderate sweetness and medium slightly metallic bitterness. Moderate body, slight oily texture, soft carbonation.

Beer Names: Evil Twin NYC Millions of Peaches, Apricots and Almonds. Peaches, Apricots and Almonds for Me
Reviews: Can [email protected], Copenhagen (25/01/2020) - hazy golden orange with a white head. Tart fruity with prominent peach, notes of apricot chiming in, getting some of the nutty almond undertones coming through, yeasty touch, medium body, tart peachy lingering fruity close.

On tap at Nepenthe Brewing Co. in Baltimore, MD. 

Opaque brown-black with a thin khaki head and fair lacing.  

Aroma of roast coffee, dark chocolate, walnut, fig and dates. 

Taste of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, fig and raisin. 

Medium body and medium carbonation.

Beer Names: Evil Twin I Talk More To The Coffee Cart Guy Than My Mom
Reviews: Can [email protected], Copenhagen (25/01/2020) - hazed yellow golden pour with a white head. Vibrant juicy fruity with notes of citrus fruit, some grapefruit and lemon, gooseberry, melon, light malty support, medium body, solid hoppy close.

Beer Names: Founders Barrel Aged CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)
Reviews: 750ml bottle from Windsor Hy-Vee, 2017 release, in a Sam Smith pint glass. Deep, rich, complex aromas of nougat, brown sugar, caramel, toffee, malted milk balls and medium-roast coffee with hints of wood smoke and green herbs. Pours inky black with two fingers of creamy chocolate head that laces gorgeously. Sweet and creamy on the entry with a distinctive maple character, turning malty and a bit fruity on the mid-palate with a long, sweet and roasty well-balanced finish, terminating with a flicker of heat as that 11.7% ABV hits bottom. Much more unique and less roast-focused than the original recipe. Ever so slightly sticky-sweet in the back of the throat. Completely satisfying and easy to drink for such a boozy full-bodied brew. Fantastic. Lives up to all the hype in spite of everything. Who doesn't love that? Founders certainly knows something about brewing beer. Thanks a million. Well done!

[email protected], Copenhagen (25/01/2020) - golden pour with a white head. Tart fruity with notes of watermelon prominence, veg and fruity notes, light salty, spritzy and effervescent, medium to light body, salty tart into the close.

Beer Names: Hoppin' Frog Barrel Aged DORIS The Destroyer
Reviews: A 22 fl. oz. bomber with no clear bottled on or best before date. Poured into a snifter glass. It was dark brown to black in colour with a very thin brown head that disappeared almost immediately and left only sparse lacing. Aromas of whiskey, roasty, chocolate, with hints of oak, molasses and vanilla. Tastes of sweet bourbon whiskey, roasty, chocolate, molasses, and oak, with notes of vanilla and caramel and maybe even some char. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, although perhaps a little sweet for me, the roast and chocolate did mostly balance it out for me, and it was still an enjoyable sipper.

355 ml can from Total Wine and More in Short Pump, Va  They need to keep the non-alcoholic beers in one area.  The ale poured a clear amber color with a white head and no lacing.  Awkward taste, with a malty aroma and grainy taste.

4/2/2020. Bottle sample courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed! Pours clear dark red / maroon with a small bubbly head. Aroma of mild blackcurrant, summer berries, light apple. Medium sweetness, minimal tartness. Moderate body, slight clammy texture, soft carbonation. Above average for this style of cider.
Found at El Tap in San Juan. Burgundy in color. Lots of cherry flavor. Intense sour.

Beer Names: Northern Monk Patrons Project 25.01 Everyday Abstract
Reviews: [email protected], Copenhagen (25/01/2020) - hazed golden pour with a white head. Fruity and malty, notes of pine needles, mango, orange, grass, soft sweet malty backing, light resinous bitter hoppy finish.

[email protected], Copenhagen (25/01/2020) (as "The Old Flax Store - Jack" appears to be same beer/style/abv) - pours golden orange with a white head. Juicy fruity with notes of grapefruit and peach, tangerine, soft malty backing, medium body, solid hoppy close. Tasty.

Beer Names: Other Half / Industrial Arts Nummy Nug Nug
Reviews: Pours a hazy, golden yellow, with mid-sized head. Aroma has some astringency, along with notes of tropical fruit and citrus. Flavor is citrus and tropical fruit, with some hop bitterness in the finish. Smooth and slightly sweet. Good stuff, this.

Beer Names: Odd Side Ales Sweet Potato Soufflé Rye Whiskey Barrel Aged Ale
Reviews:
Piana obfita i trwała. Barwa miedziana, zamglona. W aromacie gałka i cynamon przeplatają się z wanilią, koksem i melasą. W smaku słodkie, syropowe, przyprawowe, karmelowe, miodowe, wanilinowe, z rozgrzewającym finiszem. Goryczka nieduża, ziemisty finisz, gęste, ciężkie, nisko wysycone.

Taki trochę piwny kisiel z tego wyszedł, całkiem fajny jako deser...

Beer Names: Jolly Pumpkin / Jester King Citrus Commander
Reviews: [email protected], Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - hazy amber orange with a white head. Tart fruity with notes of citrus fruit, some lemon and orange notes, grapefruit, light to medium busy, tart lingering fruity close.

Acheté au IGA Benoit. La bière est rouge, littéralement. Elle produit une fine mousse blanche peux persistante. Au nez, la framboise domine largement. Au goût, on retrouve évidemment la framboise mais pas de façon sûre, plutôt de façon sucré. Sinon on retrouve également un goût un peu fumé. C’est très bon !! Facile d’approche et en même temps tellement savoureuse. Santé !

4/2/2020. Bottle sample courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed! Pours cloudy yellow gold with a small bubbly white head. Aroma of bourbon, semi-sweet apples, wood, citrus. Light sweetness and medium sour. Moderate body, slight oily texture, average carbonation. Dry, light tart, woody bourbon finish. Not particularly keen on the bourbon in this one.

Bottle at home in Hackney - picked up at Waitrose Canary Wharf. Pours clear, rich brown with a foamy, khaki head. Pleasant relaxed chocolate malts, soft roast, brown bread, very mellow earthy bitterness, nips of ripening berries. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Pretty well balanced in the finish, more cocoa, mild roast, restrained bitterness, a whisper of coffee, only a suggestion of alcohol. It goes down very easily, it must be said. No issues here.
Clear red fruit juice color pour with a thin pink head. Sour taste with an intense raspberry flavor profile. Very nice sour.
De Labirratorium. En copa Teku. Programando GestorRed. Como una lager industrial bien hecha pero sin nada especialmente memorable. Pasa desapercibida

[email protected], Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - golden pour with a white head. Light tart fruity with notes of grapefruit and lemon, wheaty and floral and hoppy accents in play, minerals, light to medium body, fruity light hoppy finish.

On draught at the taproom during the "Streetside 3 Year Anniversary Bash!" on 09/28/2019. Cloudy bright reddish burnt sienna color with a medium thin frothy off-white head that diminishes gradually to a film. Short strings of lace. Aroma of tropical fruits, wheat and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of pineapple, wheat, passionfruit and biscuit malt. The finish is a fruit juice cocktail. Pretty good overall.

[email protected], Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - brown with a off white head. Dark toasted and sweet malty with notes of caramel and toffee, some dark dried fruit, wheaty and yeasty, medium body, hoppy wheaty lingering close.

[email protected], Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - hazed golden amber with a white head. Fruity and malty with lots of prominent herbal foliage, notes of spruce, pine, floral and herbal accents against a sweet malty backbone, more spruce and herbal floral piney notes into the close.

Very hazy orange colour with medium white head, aroma very citrusy, orange, orange peel, fresh, intensive. Taste rather bitter, slightly sour, low to medium sweet, lot of orange, orange peel, intensive citrus taste. Very very good

Beer Names: Wild Weather End of Level Boss
Reviews: [email protected], Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - hazed golden amber with a white head. Pretty sweet fruity with notes of lemon and grapefruit, straw, hay, grassy bitterness, medium body, sweet malty backbone, hoppy resinous bitter close.

Beer Names: Anarchy / Bad Seed Du Hast Hopf
Reviews: [email protected], Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - orange with a white head. Sweet fruity and wheaty, with notes of banana, some light malty and wheaty notes, medium body, accents of spices into the sweet lingering finish.

4/2/2020. Bottle sample courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed! Pours cloudy amber orange with a small bubbly white head. Aroma is funky, barnyard, cinnamon apple strudel, light biscuit and pithy citrus. Medium sweetness and slight tartness. Medium body, slight oily texture, average carbonatin.

[email protected], Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - golden orange with a white head. Sweet fruity with notes of satsuma with some grapefruit and peach, zesty fruity, light body, tangy fruity hoppy finish. So so.

Pours a cloudy, ruby red coloration with a medium, frothy head. Smells of tart rasperry and zesty lime, with a distinct acidity. Taste is a great balance of slightly sweet and quite tart raspberry and rather zesty lime, with a good lactic acidity and light salinity. Finishes with a medium tartness and some raspberry and lime lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a light/medium body and mesium carbonation.

A rather nice Gose that is recognizable as the style despite being flavored, with a good lactic acidity, subtle saltiness and very little sweetness coming through. The raspberry and lime work together rather well, forming a very enjoyable flavor profile. Very crisp and refreshing, makes for a great summer beer.
Delt med Rune på rom 410 Premier Inn Waterloo, Birmingham. Gusjegrågul. Høyt luftig skum som daler sakte. God appelsinaroma. Smaken fersken & plommer. Grei - men uvariert.

Beer Names: Weird Beard Little Things That Kill (Willamette, Columbus, Bravo, Ella)
Reviews: 4th February 2020Almost clear bright gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry and has a good fine minerally biting crispness. Light lager malts, clean and with a pleasing mild sweetness. Crisp pine and crisp orange hops, touches of tangerine and grapefruit. Trace of citric peel. Crisp bright finish. Sometimes a later is the only beer that will do and this is a bloody good one.

Beer Names: Northern Monk Patrons Project 18.03 North Sea Sessions
Reviews: Can, 5%. Unclear yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, little tropical fruit and a little grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, little sweet, little grapefruit and a little bitter.

Can at the taproom during the "Streetside 3 Year Anniversary Bash!" on 09/28/2019. Hazy straw-gold color with a medium frothy white head that diminishes gradually to a film. Sticky strings of lace. Aroma of citrus, herbal hops, vanilla and malt. Medium body with flavors of pithy citrus, resiny hops, creamy vanilla and malt. The finish is mildly bitter hops up front with a vanilla aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

Sample at the taproom during the "Streetside 3 Year Anniversary Bash!" on 09/28/2019. Crystal clear pale orange color with a thin white head that dissipates quickly to a sparse outer ring. Spotty lace. Aroma of oak, tart fruit, yeast and malt. Light to medium body with flavors of gin, tart citrus, vinous oak and juniper. The finish is oaky and very tart with a lingering red wine and sour fruit aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

[email protected] Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - hazed yellow with a white head. Tropical fruity medley going on, some lemon, grapefruit, some pineapple, soft sweet malts, medium to light body, hoppy finish.
[email protected] Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - hazy golden orange with a white head. Light tart fruity with notes of peach, grapefruit. some stone fruit, light malty, yeasty note, tart fruity finish.

Beer Names: Wylam / Naparbier Empathy For the Devil
Reviews: [email protected] Copenhagen (23/01/2020) - golden hazed pour with a white head. Juicy fruity with a plethora of tropical fruit offered, waves of papaya, mango and grapefruit, pine needles, soft malty backing, medium body, touch of citrus rind bitterness into the hoppy close. Great stuff.

Sample at the taproom during the "Streetside 3 Year Anniversary Bash!" on 09/28/2019. Slightly hazy amber-orange color with a medium thin white head that recedes steadily to an outer ring. Stringy lace. Fruity and oaky aroma with wine and malt notes. Medium body with an oaky white wine character and notes of funky yeast, tart citrus and bready malt. The finish is oaky and tart with a wine grape aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

440ml can. Cloudy, bright, light red colour with average to huge, diminishing, minimally pink-ish, off-white head. Sweet-ish, fruity, raspberry dominated aroma, some cherry, some fruit acid, slight sherbet character overall. Taste is mildly tart, minimally sweet fruity, slightly lactic, diluted hints of cherry and raspberry with a minimally leafy touch, cautious hints of mild sauerkraut. Well balanced, refreshing, nice.
Honey pecan nose. Clear amber, medium head. Pecan. Medoum body, moderate carbonation.

4/2/2020. Bottle sample courtesy of danlo, cheers Ed! Pours hazy golden orange with a small bubbly white head. Aroma of funky apples, light brown sugar, caramel and a hint of spice. Moderate sweetness and light to moderate tartness. Moderate body, slight oily texture, above average carbonation. Dry, tangy tart finish. Nice.

Sample at the taproom during the "Streetside 3 Year Anniversary Bash!" on 09/28/2019. Slightly hazy reddish-orange color with a medium thin white head that dissipates quickly to a wispy film. Short strings of lace. Aroma of herbal yeast, fruit, tea and malt. Medium body with flavors of mildly funky yeast, sweet-tart melon, green tea, vinous oak and doughy malt. The finish is oaky, funky and tart with a fruity yeast aftertaste. Good beer all around.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester.  Extremely dark and certainly strong tasting, this slow sipper does have a velvet smoothness to its roasted malts that's very pleasant once you get used to the alcohol content in this one.  Sat in my cellar for over 6 years but absolutely fine when opened.
Watery, not much flavour, but nice bitterness and nice after taste. Nice dark brown colour, wait actually quite red.
Very decent and notably smooth double IPA, avoiding much of the hop burn. On tap at the source.
can. pale golden. pale lagery malty nose, light green herby citrus. med light bodied, good bitters, citrussy slight zingy finish. a clean crisp thing. lawnmover-like beer.

Beer Names: Town Fruit Dart - Blackberry, Lemon & Vanilla
Reviews: Lightly tart, quaffable stuff and smooth outside of its base.  Good fruit overall.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co Big House Waltz
Reviews: Can sourced from Kihoskh - totally opaque orange colour with a medium creamy white head. Bold intense juicy fruity with some papaya and mango, lychee, substantial mouthfeel and medium plus body, pine needles and light bitter tingling hop spice, robust dank hoppy close. Gorgeous stuff.
Labelled as an IPA and hoppy, without hop burn.  Understated, today's American pale really.  Good and smooth.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co The Leafcutter DDH IPA
Reviews: Can sourced from Kihoskh - hazy golden yellow with a white head. Juicy fruity with some tasty notes of mango, pineapple, grapefruit, smooth creamy substantial mouthfeel and medium body, light rindy citrus bitterness into the lingering hoppy finish. Beautiful.
Malt job, hits the style but would like a touch of spice to make it interesting.  At the source.
Very roasty and watered down stout, on tap at the source.  Not so quaffable.

Beer Names: Brew By Numbers 42/06 DDH Pale Ale - Number Six
Reviews: Can at home in Hackney - picked up from the Bermondsey taproom. Pours lightly hazy gold with a modest, foamy white head. Great stuff overall, definitely one of the better BBNo hoppy beers I have had recently. Has light sweetness, pleasant pithy citrus, only a whisper of minerality, some melon, tangerine, mild rindy bitterness, background pale malts. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Nicely balanced finish, with a hint of cat pee, tropical accents, more pithy citrus. Really sound.

Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours hazy red/brown with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like butter toffee, raisin, molasses, and earthy malt. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like raisin, earthy malt, toffee, and molasses.

Beer Names: Anchor Brewers' Pale Ale - Galaxy Hop Blend
Reviews: 34.5cl fles. Troebel heel van kleur, fijne romige witte schuimkraag. De geur is muf en citrus. Smaak is zoet, mout, citrus en licht perzik. Medium body en veel koolzuur.

Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours hazy gold with a frothy white head. Tastes like resin, leather, pine hops, grassy malt, and grapefruit. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like resin, leather, pine hops, grassy malt, and grapefruit.
Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours cola  brown with a creamy beige head. Tastes like raisin cinnamon, and earthy malt. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like earth, cinnamon, and raisin.
Can from Tesco. A slightly hazy orange, with a thin head. A nice mix of fruit with a touch of spice. Not one for quaffing at 5.6%, but it's alright, good for the price.
black beer with a decent brown head. Roasted Malt, coffee, caramel, raisins and liquorice. Not too heavy in Alcohol and nicely balanced.

Beer Names: Brew By Numbers 21/05 Pale Ale - Citra
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml shared with Simon, Max and Miro B. Hazy yellow, medium white head. Fruity, dank, some tropical fruit, citrus, smooth. Medium bodied.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co Ute West Yorkshire IPA
Reviews:
27/IX/19 - on tap @ Borefts Day 1, BB: n/a - (2019-1560) Thanks to the international RateBeer Crew for sharing today's beers!

Little cloudy blond to beige beer, creamy white head, little stable, somewhat adhesive. Aroma: super fruity, lots of tropical fruits, oranges, very nice! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter, malty, grains, hay, tropical fruits, citrus, grapefruit, nice bitterness. Aftertaste: very bitter, grapefruit, lovely!

Orange hazy with a two centimetre thick head.
Smell of mango, passion fruit and grapefruit with a grainy note. Full bodied IPA with a pleasant bitterness and dominant fruit notes, with a little gingerbread something.
A very tasty and drinkable IPA.

very clear, light-yellow colour
white foam that dissolves quickly and leaves little residue
smells of hay, flowers—rose?
tastes surprisingly like blossom honey—sweet, malty, floral notes
oily mouthfeel, no distinct carbonation, lingers relatively shortly
great beer if you’ve got a sweet tooth

Got this scary can from JRs. Was not looking forward to this tick. After all, it says it has some artificial flavors in it. Pours clear pale from a pounder can.  Smell is somewhat artificial apple, like hardtack candy. Taste is as expected, somewhat rude ass artificial apple candy with a vanilla backbone. Cannot get this. It also has a warming sensation as it goes down the gullet. Can't say I'm disjointed because I didn't expect much. I had high hopes for the Blockhouse brand but I'm afraid they are just turning into another alky laced soda pop brand. This stuff is more on the line of those kindah malt beverages, has little to do with beer, thanks. I'm going to mix the rest of this with a can of IC light to try to straighten it out a bit and make it more acceptable. Whew.

Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours hazy gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like guava, pear, booze, resin, and pineapple. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like booze, resin, pineapple, and pear.

Beer Names: Brew By Numbers 55 Double IPA - Mosaic Citra
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml, shared with Simon, Max and Miro B. Hazy yellow, white head. Tropical fruit, bit dank, quite dry, smooth. Medium bodied.

Beer Names: Wild Weather / New Lion War Against Reality
Reviews:
Rocky white head stayed on a murky dark amber coloured still body.
Pineapple, Tropical fruits, mango & confectionery aroma.
Medium bodied, pleasantly carbonated on the front with soft smooth back.
Tropical fruits, mango, kiwi, hoppy, garlic & nectarine tastes.

Beer Names: The Kernel Foeder Beer Nelson Sauvin
Reviews: Bottle at home in Hackney - picked up at the brewery. Pours mostly clear gold with a frothy, pure white head. Incredible beer, with a gorgeous mix of pissy southern hemisphere hop and farmyard funk. Lightly sweet, only a little bitterness, perhaps a touch of pine and lemon rind. Light bodied with delicate, massaging carbonation. Balanced finish with a hint of acidity, further cat pee, dry brett funk, melon, mild citrus. Exceptional.
Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Tastes like light funk, citrus, hay and dry peach. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like funk, hay, peach, and leather.

Beer Names: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout
Reviews: Almost black with low head. Aroma with coffee and chocolate. Some dried fruit in the taste, together with chocolate. Stored several years in the cellar and still fresh taste.

Beer Names: Central Waters Brewer's Reserve Belgian Style Quadruple Ale
Reviews: Proefglas van 35,5cl-fles. U; Troebel amber-bruin met een rode gloed e neen dunne cremekleurige schuimkraag. G: Bourbon, hout, ietwat vanille, gedroogd fruit en kandijsuiker. S: Zoet. Karamel, gedroogd fruit, beetje vanille en bourbon. Alcoholwarmte. M: Volmondig met een lichte carbonatie.

Proefglas van 47,3cl-blik. U: Modderig blond met een witte schuimkraag. G: "Dank", ananas, citrus, "zweterig" en wat hars. S: Zoet met wat hopbitterheid. Fruit punch met o.a. ananas en lychee, citrus, "dank", den en een hint van zeep. Droge afdronk. M: Smooth met medium carbonatie.

Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Pours clear gold with a creamy white head. Tastes like chardonnay, smooth lemon, grassy malt, white grape, and funk. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like chardonnay, grassy malt, white grape, yeast, and funk.

Beer Names: Night Shift  / Vanished Valley Cobbled Together
Reviews: Draft at Lovejoy Wharf. Tastes like peach, tart citrus, cracker malt, and vanilla. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like peach, citrus, cracker malt, and vanilla.

Beer Names: Tampa Bay Old Elephant Foot IPA
Reviews: Brukar ju inte betygsätta Ipa på ratebeer men denna lite speciell . Ok nu kommer omdömet . Läs nu . Fat på Kapitelhuset Växjö. Doftar cederträ och ek samt nybakat bröd från Bröd och Sovel . Skakar maltigt och blommigt som fan. Udda smakrik Ipa . Blommig parfymig och tydlig efterbeska . Spännande Ipa
Old school Sierra bitter hip juice. On tap at p house. Hazy orange golden with small to medium head. Nice lace. Grapefruit, pine, and orange rind. Nice
Can. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are nice bitter hops, fruits, flowers, malt and has a nice long bitter finish.

Barwa pomarańczowa, piwo mętne, piana biała, zbita, zdobiąca szkło.
Aromat średnio-intensywny, cytrusowy, w tyle słodkie pomarańcze.
W smaku mega soczyste, gładkie, lekko słodkie. Dużo pomarańczy - słodki sok, gorzka skórka pomarańczy. Goryczka srednio-wysoka, grejpfrutowa, lekko pylasta. Alkohol niewyczuwalny.

Farbe: schwarz. Pechschwarz. OK, im Strahl dunkelbraun.
Schaum: dicht beständig, hellbraun 
Nase: säuerlich, nicht viel. Möh. Bisschen Cola. Bei leererem Glas kommt auch karamrll, Asche und Holz raus.
Geschmack: relativ sauer, feinsprudlig, dann ordentlich bitter, dann aber auch rund, hat wohl ordentlich Malz und Hopfen drin.abgang dann gerösteter Malz, im Nachgeschmack kommt die säuerliche Asche dazu. Äh das meinen die auf der Flasche mit Kaffee und Bitterschokolade. Komplex aber nicht ganz meins.

Butelka. Ładny ,złoty,klarowny kolor. Piana średnia,biała,opadła szybko. W aromacie słodki mix tropików, wyraźne nuty żywicy. W smaku początkowo słodko,karmel,syrop,mix owoców,lekkie słodkie cytrusy,później wyraźną goryczka,żywiczna ,zalegająca. Wysycenie raczej małe,lekko oleista tekstura.
Aroma is bready malts, slight citrus and very basic Pilsner all around. The flavor is bready malts, mild fruit/citrus and a smooth/medium grainy finish.
Aroma is fresh strawberries. Tart strawberry notes shine through in the flavor as well, along with a bit of tannins and some funk. Pretty good.

Beer Names: Flash House Dark Chocolate & Mint Porter
Reviews: På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Filmskum. Aroma av After Eight. Smaken bare mint. Uvariert. Lett tørr avslutning

Słomkowe. Lekko zamglone. Piana spora, szamponowa. 
W aromacie chmiele amerykańskie zdominowane przez kolendrę. Trochę żelaza – to od chmielu. 
Zbożowo i wodniście. Dopiero w posmaku czuć trochę goryczki. 
Piwo jest bardzo lekkie.  Słodkawe. Nawet nie bardzo brzeczkowe. 
Jako bezalko nawet nawet.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gråbrun. Uklar. Filmskum. Klementinaroma. Smaken søte plommer. Tørr syrlig ettersmak.
Piwo złote, zmętnione. Piana niska, szybko opada. W aromacie cytrusy. W smaku delikatna grapefruitowa goryczka. Pełnia niska. Wysycenie średnie.

Beer Names: By The Horns / Flavourly Fresh Tracks Lager
Reviews: Keg at By the Horns Brewery, Summerstown.  Clear mid golden.  Quite a crisp lager, but with a pretty decent flavour.

500ml bottle via Appleyards, Shrewsbury. Clear gold appearance. Foamy white head. Moderately sweet malt on the nose. Taste presents a moderately sweet, crisp, bright fruity hops. A proper real ale named after a steam locamotive with picture of said train on the bottle. I believe I've actually travelled on this at the Severn valley railway too. Excellent sweet blonde real ale.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Mørk gylden. Uklar. Filmskum. Sitrusaroma. Smaken tørr. Papir & mango. Litt bitter avslutning.

330ml glass bottle from Seven Seasons, Hoxton. Served at cellar temperature into a stout glass. Dated as bottled on 17/05/19. 

The beer pours a perfect black colour developing a one and a half finger mocha colour head. Uniform with medium sized bubbles. The head settles to a thick layer before finally disappearing half way through the drink. A lovely lacing. Visually this one looks like a top beer. 

The aroma has an identical profile to tiramisu. Heavy dark roasted coffee. Vanilla. Woody. Muscovado. Figs. Coffee, and the woody smell of the barrel ageing are the dominant notes. Nasally stunning. 

The taste is where the beer deviates away from great, in my opinion. Too alcoholic. I do understand the beer is 11.5% and imperial in style, but on the tastebuds the alcohol dominates and little else is present. I feel as the only reason I can taste coffee, vanilla or oak is because of the strength of aroma leading to perception. The beer is moderately sweet. 

The beer feels thick in the mouth, a lot of alcohol warmth, also in the pit of the stomach. A slightly dry, moderately sweet feel. 

Maybe just too much for my palate. A great beer for look and aroma but too heavily dominated by booze on the taste. 

One I’d put in the same category as Samuel Smiths Chocolate Stout. I think it would be good in a very small amount. But even on a slow slow drink 330 feels far too much. A sharer.

500 ml bottle from Tavour, 2/4/20.  2019 Reserve, Bottled 3/18/19.  Pours a darker, rusty orange color with a thick, foamy and frothy, beige head.  Strongly funky / peppery, some wood, herbal, pear, and grape notes.  Bright, tingly, and fairly tart.  A nice complexity has been developed at this point.  I could see it changing with more age, but as it is right now, it is drinking nicely.  Nicely blended.  
7/4/8/4/16
# 1814; 2/2020. Rice and grains in aroma. Gold, clear body. Light body, worty, grainy, herbal, very sweet. Bad lager. 0,3 l bottle from asian food shop, Prague. Somewhere in EU produced beer.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Filmskum. Plommearoma. Smaken plommer & rips. Tørr bæraktig avslutning.
Bottle. Zlatá farba, biela pena, výrazný sediment. Vôňa sladová, chlebová, mierne citrus, chmeľ. Chuť sladová, citrusová. Mierna horká dochuť.

Beer Names: Brick (UK) / Dogma Druže Cherry & Fig Schwarzbier
Reviews: Canned, 330 ml, shared with Max. Brown, small beige head. Caramel, some figs, watery, vague cherries. Sweetish. Thin finish. A mess really.
Beer with copper color, fuzzy aspect, soft bitterness, soft carbonized, some of foam on top, (shared a 50cl bottle beer with PG, bought at "NORMA", Großmehring, DE #1095)(#155 DE)(#73 Bavaria).
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Mokkafarget skumring. Lakrisaroma. Smaken røyk&sjokolade. Tørr avslutning.

Beer Names: Brew By Numbers 75 Sour IPA - Amarillo, Columbus, Simcoe
Reviews: Canned, 440 ml, courtesy of Miro. Shared with him and Max. Hazy yellow, no head. Sour, citric, low carbonation. Some bitterness in finish. Medium bodied.
Smell of hops, spruce. Clear amber colour, high off-white head. Aroma of hops, spruce, a faint of honey. Regular IIPA with pure flavours. Bitter. Medium carbon, slightly oily texture.

Beer Names: Gipsy Hill / Ignition Brewing Social Brew Collective
Reviews:
2 finger white head. Weak lacing.
Very hazy, mid yellow to light orange coloured beer.

Aroma of clementine, creamy mango, overripe pineapple, passionfruit and sweet white bread.

Taste of pink grapefruit, orange peels, clementine, tree resin, unripe passionfruit and lightly phenolic.

Mouthfeel is semi-dense but with light edges that makes it very drinkable. Medium bitterness. Medium carbonation.  A bit fizzy. Lightly astringent. Watery finish.

Poured dark mahogany body with tan cream lace top. A definite coffee malt aroma. Taste is medium sweet (milk chocolate) to bitter (coffee grounds). A little background fruit. Palate is medium bodied creamy texture soft to average carbonation and a bitter finish. Delivers a mocha stout.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Amber. Litt uklar. Skumring. Aroma av søt frukt. Smaken jordbærsyltetøy. Lett tørr avslutning.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, 4th February 2020.  Shit the bed this is a good one.  Pours black with a red hue, aroma is vineous, almost barrel, roasted notes.  Taste is smooth, vinous, tart, roasted notes, young grapes, it’s a perfect blend and very unusual, light and easy to drink, probably dangerous :)

Clear golden with a thin head.
Strawy smell with a strong corn note. Not much going on at the attack, later a malty taste with a little acidity and bitterness develops. But in general this beer is weak bodied and bland. Low carbonation.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Mørk gylden. Luftig filmskum. Plommearoma. Smaken svisker & plommer. Litt tynn. Tørr, papiraktig avslutning.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Svart. Luftig skumring. Krydret sjokoladearoma. Smaken kanel. Tørr avslutning.

Belle bière noire avec une mousse beige à très fines bulles bien engageante. Nez : malts, fruits noirs, caramel, porto. Bouche vive, crémeuse, ronde et onctueuse avec candi, pruneau, mélasse, chocolat, épices, petite acidité. Carbonatation moyenne et finale un peu sirupeuse, amère et épicée. Je lui mettrais bien 5 Pistoles à cette quadruple dégustée dans mon verre de chez "La Trappe" !!
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Skumring. Blomsteraroma. Smaken overmoden bær. Tørr avslutning.
Bouteille de 500 ml. Arômes de fruits exotiques et de houblon. Goût d'orange, d'ananas, de mangue, de citron et de houblon floral. Très bonne NEIPA.
Brew York Tonkoko 4.3%. Blackish ruby, dark chocolate malt and coconut aroma, full bodied, dark chocolate malt, toasted coconut, vanilla, deep complex flavours. Stunning milk stout from York 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿

Z zapasów po WFP. Złote, klarowne. Piana wysoka, trwała, lepi szkło. W aromacie owoce -  tropiki (ananas, mango, melon). W smaku wysoka, wyraźna, trochę zalegająca goryczka. Wytrawne. Średnie wysycenie.
Alcohol taste.medium bodied. High carbonated. Very clear appereance and good foam. Lots of flavours. Spicy, banana wheat vanilla notes. Rich yeast taste
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gylden. Litt uklar. Skumring. Lett bæraroma. Smaken mere bær. Lett tørr & søt avslutning.
# 1139; 7/2018. Výborný doppelbock. Hezky vazký, plný sladkého ovoce. Ač v chuti patrný alkohol, velmi dobře pitelný.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gusjegråbrun. 0 skum. Aroma av malt & fersken. Smaken tørket frukt. Lett tørr avslutning.

Bottle 33cl. @home poured into a shaker. Hazy pale golden, good frothy white head, good retention and lacing. Aroma sweet malt, grain, light citrus, grass. Taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, grainy, light metallic, hint lemon. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, dry sweetbitter aftertaste, light herbal and mineral notes, refreshing lager, okay.

Flaska från Hopt.se. Disig smutsigt gyllengul med lågt vitt skum. Ganska platt både till kropp och smakbild. Jäst, deg, surdegsbröd, lite örter. Skulle mått bra av lite sälta. Aningen syrlig. Inte dålig men på gränsen.
# 1132; 7/2018. Version 2017. Velmi dobrý weizenbock, hezky sladce meruňový a kořeněný.

Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is hoppy, fruity and a hint of salt. Taste is aswell fruity and a little bitter. Very good beer for the style. You dont taste it is alcohol free beer. My favourit alcohol free beer.
Bottle. Hazy deep golden color with a huge foamy white head. Mild aroma of banana and wheat. Mild wheaty taste. Medium thin body.
Keg at We Brought Beer, Tooting.  Lightly Hazy pale straw.  Spicy, herbal hop nose.  A bit more sharpness from the Chinook.  Similar in the flavour.
Cask at  Black Door. Hazy yellow colour and small steady white head. Green grass, wheat and some juicyness in the nose. Light-bodied. Pineapple, grass, sweetness. Smooth oaty palate. Nice.
Süßlich herber Beginn, angenehm, leider schnell metallern werdend. Mild würzig, trocken bitter werdend. Zum Ende stark bitter ohne weitere Aromen. 9/8/7/7/8/7
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Lysebrunt skumring. Utmerket sjokoladearoma. Smaken det samme ispedd litt vanilje.

Tiefdunkles Braun im Glas mit stabilem, hellen Schaum. In der Nase malzig, Zuckerrübensirup, Schokolade, etwas Kaffeepulver. Im Mund eine karamellige Süße, porterähnlich, vergorene Brombeeren,  Amarena-Kirsche, Schokoladenmousse, Malzsirup und im Abgang etwas bittere Kaffeenoten.

Keg at MS HW, 25/01/20.
Clear golden blonde with a decent white cap.
Nose is pale malts, grass, toasted grains, light dusting of funk, citric tinged straw.
Taste comprises hay bale, lemon rind, dusty fruit esters, grains, light farmyard elements.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok simple farmyard kind of affair.

Bottled October 30th with a note that says shelf life 6 months.

It pours black but not pitch black, a finger of tannish foam, excellent lacing.

I get notes of coffee leaning towards a coffee grounds bitterness. Milky is definitely present.

Lots of coffee and milk in the taste, bringing both bitter and sweet flavours. The finish has some chocolate to it. Quite the tasty beer.

Medium bodied with lightish carbonation.

Nice.
Keg @ Smithfield Market Tavern, Manchester.  Copper-red with a small head.  It's a red berry sweetened lager with a mid carbonation.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Mørk gyldenbrun. Så vidt litt skumring. Beskjeden sitrusaroma. Smaken tørket frukt. Lett tørr bitter avslutning.

Cask @ Crown & Kettle, Manchester.  Smooth hoppy and dangerously easy in the palate for its strength, in part due to its watery-clean texture, it's not thin though.  There's a hint of milkshake sweetness.  Golden with a creamy head and a mild spice develops in the palate.
500 ml bottle. Cloudy dark orange, big fluffy head. Citrus, yeast, bread, banana, a bit clove and pineapple. Mild dryness. Medium bodied, oily texture, lively to soft carbonated, dry finish. Good!

A really nice porter with coffee and chocolate malt in the aroma. Poured dark mahogany body with scummy lace top. Taste is sweet chocolate and bitter coffee with a smooth transition and good bitter finish. In fact I just convinced myself to raise it a point for taste. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture, average to soft carbonation and a bitter finish. Far above some other cask porters but I have been spoiled by craft flavour and a longstanding bias towards fruit porters over coffee.
On tap at the brewpub. Deep gold with a fine foam and a distinct honey nose. Sweet and malty, mild bitterness, a little sweet overall but very drinkable.
Medium smoke, but it is quite pleasant. Underlying super crisp light bodied lager. Online hier gibt bier

Poured dark brown amber with tan lace top. Aroma of brown bread and light berry hops. Taste is medium sweet initially with fruity and toffee notes. Sour finish. Palate is medium bodied oily texture average carbonation and a souring mash finish. Expected something else from an old ale more richness in the finish, perhaps.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gyldengul. Filmskum. Nesten klar. Lett ferskenaroma. Smaken plommer & vanilje. Lett tørr avslutning.

Beer Names: North Brewing Co Dazed and Awake
Reviews: A small taste from a friend (can) @ One Pint Pub. Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is sweet and dank malts with some fruits. Flavor is sweet and dank juicy malts with some hops. Very good.
Cask at GBBF Winter 2020, near black with a loose tan foam, malty sweet and roasty nose, fruity and sweet with a burnt edge, malty-dry on the finish. A little cloying but very nice.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gyldengul. Filmskum. Blomsteraroma. Smaken papp & blomster. Litt tett avslutning.
Lilly bouquet. Clear golden, thick head, good lace. Lilly, grapefruit, rosehip. Medium body, easy carbonation.
Cask at GBBF Winter 2020 with Rune & Finn, hay red-brown with a loose foam, lightly acetic nose, fresh and cleansing, then tart and earthy-fruity, mild for sour and very quafffable.
V 100 piv. Vyrazna silna visnova vona. Visnova tmava farba ruzovkasta pena. Chut kyselkasta visnova prijemna. Dlho sa drzi
440ml can. Crisp, chewy hoppy and juicy tropical fruity with some pine, herbal notes, hints of grass, floral notes and citrus. Pretty good.
Very good papaya smell...taste is a malty IPA with medium strength papaya that's covered up by the thick malt and medium hops...finishes dry and bitter
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune & BeerViking. Dyp brun. Syrlig fruktaroma. Smaken syrlig. Plommer. Tørr avslutning.

On tap at 100 pív.
Pours ruby with pink head. 
Sour cherry on a nose. Dry, sourish, sour cherries, bit of barique feel. Tasty
Taster at taproom. Rich, golden body with a fine layer of foam. Aroma and taste offer a deep malt bill with a gentle layer of bittering hops. Big and bready with a small crisp bite.
På GBBF Winter 2020 i Birmingham. Delt med Rune. Gusjegråbrun. Filmskum. Uklar. Lett bæraroma. Smaken fjøs. Ettersmaken det samme.

Beer Names: Anchor Our Special Ale (2005 and later)
Reviews: mørk brun, treaktig, tørket frukt, krydret..................................
lys strågul, korn, lett frisk anonym og tynn uten usmaker...................
440ml can. Almost black with a tan head. Aroma of roast malts, ashy, dark chocolate. Taste is very roasty, ashy, dark chocolate, molasses. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.
Cask at GBBF Winter 2020, deep brown with a lasting fine ring, plummy and berry nose with hints of cocoa leads into a dusty dry-bitter and tangy body. Nice!

355 ml can.
Pours clear copper color with a large head. Nice resinous hoppy aroma with pine notes, slightly malty, some orange and citrus as well as some mango. Flavor is resinous hoppy, some caramel tones, mouthwatering citrus, hop oily slick palate, malty bitter finish. Alcohol is barely noticeable here, great balance between resinous hops and bitter malts. Great.
4616
1/2 pint on tap @ One Pint Pub. Pours hazy yellow with a medium creamy head. Aroma is sweet fruity malts. Flavor is sweet malts with some fruity notes and some hops. Good.

Draft. An unclear golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of spices, hops, citrus fruits, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, citrus fruits, spices, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle split at L6 at the Tipple's had tasting, thanks to LKS, 17/04/19.
Extremely dark mahogany brown with a lasting beige cap.
Nose is fruit cake, toffee, charr, brown sugars, dusty fruits, light spice.
Taste comprises stewed fruits, brown sugars, dates, figs, dark malts, molasses, toffee, fruit loaf.
Medium plus bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a light boost.
Ok BW.

Kolor ciemno bursztynowy, może nawet bordowy, opalizujący. Piana barwy ecru, wysoka, o średnim czasie redukcji.
Aromat słodki i wytrawny zarazem, są ciemne suszone owoce, śliwy, figi, daktyle, są rodzynki. Dalej słodka słodowość, ciemny chleb. Po delikatnym ogrzaniu pojawiają się akcenty winne, winogrona, czerwone owoce.
Smak idzie w kierunku winnego, jest lekko kwaskowy, wytrawny, są czerwone owoce, winogrona, wiśnie. Słodowość jest nieco wycofana, choć dalej czuć ciemne owoce. Ponownie ciemne pieczywo, pumpernikiel, trochę akcentów ziemistych.
Alkohol tylko na początku delikatnie rozgrzewał. Wysycenie średnie. Sporo ciała. Piwo jest bardzo gładkie, miękkie.

Beer Names: Dieu du Ciel! Péché Mortel Mexicaine
Reviews:
Glass, 5-ounce, draught, gift from Mathieu Vidal, drunk at the St-Jérôme brewery, savoured on February 2, 2019; eye: black, ring of brown head, opaque, no lacing; nose: spices, spicy cake, light vanilla, coffee, light roast, fresh; mouth: spices, spicy cake, light vanilla, coffee, light roast, fresh, tangy finale, full body, medium carbonation, lightly sweet, tangy texture; overall: nice surprise
 

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 5 onces, en fût, bue à la brasserie de St-Jérôme, savourée le 2 février 2019; œil : noire, anneau de mousse brune, opaque, pas de dentelle; nez : épices, gâteau épicé, léger vanille, café, léger torréfaction, frais; bouche : épices, gâteau épicé, léger vanille, café, léger torréfaction, frais, finale piquante, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, légèrement sucrée, texture piquante; en résumé : belle surprise

Sierra Nebmvada really knows how to celebrate an anniversary. Their 40th IPA is truly a victory of brewing. It's a balanced affair that channels their west coast pedigree while still delivering interest and quality. A solid light malt backbone lifts an impressive resiny piney hop bill that is both familiar and engaging at the same time.  Nice long hoppy finish that still manages to avoid rindiness. Quite clean. Awesome lacing too. This is why they are the west coast kings.
keg at monties... soft passion orange green hop nose... Light dry green hop.. long dru tropical fruit... soft sharp dry fruit

Bottle split at L6 at the Tipple's had tasting, thanks to Leighton, 17/04/19.
Mahogany brown with a well presented beige covering.
Nose is dried fruits, dates, toffee, dark malts, light oak, spice.
Taste comprises fruit cake, dried prunes, spice, dark malts, hint of rum, earthy, dates, stewed fruits.
Medium plus bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a lick of booze.
Decent Quad.

330 ml bottle.  Pours dark red with tall, long lasting, fluffy beige head and nice lacing.  Aroma is of bready malt, sweet cherries and  caramel.  Body is full, creamy and slightly crisp.  Taste is of caramel malt, herbal hops and cherries.  Finish is long, almost dry. Nice brew.

Can split at L6 at the Tipple's had tasting, from a trade with some jaun I imagine, 17/04/19.
Clear golden with a decent off white cap.
Nose is pale malts, straw, toasted grains, light bread dough.
Taste comprises pale and bready malts, toasted grains, grass, lemon zest, cereals.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Not bad.
